Reviews.Title: “Good value in Rome but we found it too far to walk to attractions”
Reviews.Author: NjRobin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights after Easter 2012. The hotel was indeed clean but the lobby had a foul smell. The room was small but adequate and clean. The shower was awful, small and had louver doors that did not stay shut so there was water all over after every shower. The breakfast was good and the woman who ran the area was nice, kept the area clean and stocked with good foods. The front desk people were nice, helpful when checking in with a map and location of hotel. We did not walk to any attractions as it was rainy and the hotel was simply too far from most things including the Forum and Colesseum and of course Vatican City. I did not like the area around the Termini, it was heavily traveled and always busy with tons of people. Not the best area to be wandering around but we felt safe enough. We had a couple of meals near the hotel, not the greatest but good. Overall a clean, modern hotel and I believe it is popular because the price is right. I would stay closer to the areas most tourists go to Rome to see next time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, beautiful room. Super friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Jenwilliams54
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel we stayed in on our 2 week honeymoon in Italy. It was super clean, modern and larger than expected. Most important to me was the en suite bathroom. The breakfast was great. Had eggs , bacon and fruit which was important to me because I have celiac disease and cannot consume wheat so pastry is out of question. The front desk staff were all very nice and super helpful. Access to free wifi in the lobby was a huge bonus.

Reviews.Title: “3 nights stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel very clean, staff very friendly and helpful. Location just a few minutes walk to the main 'Termini' (bus station) Excellent if using the Ryan Air shuttle bus as it's just a short distance away. Quite central for visitiing attractions. The only negative would be that the rooms are quite small and have no tea or coffee making facilities which would have been nice after a long day on your feet!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Very Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: atlgal77
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel and the staff was so great to me. They gave me a free room upgrade, which was awesome. The only thing I found not so great was it is not in walking distance of the major areas of Rome. I took taxis everywhere to avoid taking the train (except my last day from the Vatican), as I had been advised about pick pocketers. The Termini train station is very close, which made getting there from the airport very easy. If you can get to all your destinations in Rome on the train then you will be fine with this hotel. Or you can take cabs like I did. I like the modern look and cleanliness of the hotel. The morning breakfast was a little skimpy but it was enough for me to fuel up for exploring the city and then eat my heart away at many Italian restaurants. I felt very safe and comfortable in this hotel. The bed was a little firm for my taste, but after days of walking everywhere, it felt just fine and opening my windows to hear the sound of the city was awesome. My favorite hotel moment was the church bells going off at 7am in the distant. I would stay here again and get more acquainted with the train system and use less cabs. All in all, it is a nice place with very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel, excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: A M
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff. Very clean. Full breakfast included scrambled eggs, selection of meats and cheeses, pastries, cereal, and yogurt. Quiet rooms. Free wifi in the lobby, 2 euros / day or 5 euros / stay for room wifi. Very short walk to train/metro station, even with bags. Only minor downside was that we didn't find any really good restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Small, close to termini, confy”
Reviews.Author: GabiGarcia
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, very close the Roma Termini, friendly staff, the room we stayed in was very small, not much space to luggage but we were staying for just one night, no big problem! Clean room and bathroom, very small shower, comfy bed. Breakfast not very fancy but satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Yes to the Yes Hotel, Rome”
Reviews.Author: Blossomcat41
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 nights in Rome, staying in the Yes Hotel. Located close to the main Terminus,(both rail and metro) this hotel is ideally situated. It is also within reasonable walking distance of the majority of the main tourist sites. There are also nearby restaurants and trattoria and local shops. The hotel has about 40 rooms, is very modern and well presented with comfortable beds. The staff, especially Marcello, were very helpful and welcoming. Breakfast was fairly substantial, with both cooked and continental choices. The hotel has free wifi and internet access. The bar was small with not a great deal of choice but they did not object to us taking back and drinking our own bottle of Limoncello! Only negative was the lack of comfy armchairs and (beyond the control of the hotel) the bells that rang at 7:00am waking everyone. Overall excellent value for money and would definately recommend it as somewhere to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Nic Q
Reviews.Content: You could not get a better located hotel for the price you pay! 30 Minute train ride from the airport to Termini station and then a 5 minute walk from there! The Termini Station is the main train, bus and metro station in Rome so ideally situated to get around the city. Is also walking distance to most places but wouldnt suggest walking everywhere in 1 day as we did! 3 day travel pass is only 11 euros and well worth it! Our room was modern, clean and spacious and well equiped for a city hotel room - couldnt have asked for more. Breakfast was included and was a buffet of cold meats, bacon, cheese, breads, pastries, yoghurt and fruit with all hot drinks and juices - Well appreciated before setting off for a day of sight seeing!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lindavw
Reviews.Content: we stayed from 27th March until the 30th March on a site seeing trip. I have to say the Yes Hotel has to be one of the cleanest hotels that I have ever stayed in! Our stay was absolutely wonderful from check in with Marcello, who gave have us a map and showed us routes to the attractions, until when we left on Friday afternoon where we were asked if we wanted to leave our bags until we were ready to depart. Upon picking up our bags we were even offered to use the toilet facilities without having to ask, very considerate of reception. Breakfast was lovely everything fresh and set out perfectly! The lady who does the breakfast was very friendly and always had a smile and a hello for us. Our room was very cosy with a very comfortable bed, and lovely crisp white sheets. we slept very well. The room is of a high standard for the price paid. I can hoestly say I think this hotel should be rated higher than a three star. I have stayed in a lot of up market hotels, but found the hospitality of the Yes to be second to none. I was sad to leave Rome and the Yes hotel. I would not hesitate in booking at the Yes on my next visit to Rome. Thank you for making our stay a special one.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: soccermom327
Reviews.Content: We just spent 2 nights here. The staff is helpful, the rooms were clean and we were close to Termini station which was important to us. Reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Say Yes to YES hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GINDYGLASGOW
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with very helpful friendly staff in a great location for travelling around Rome. Train statin close by handy if getting train from and to airport. Underground also close by for transport. Rooms are nice and clean. TV, safe, fridge and good size bathroom with shower. Breakfast is adequate and the lady running the breakfast service does a good job to ensure everything is fine at all times. Any questions or problems the staff will do their best to help you. So glad I stayed here as it made the trip to Rome even better and if I come back to Rome I will be booking this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Helper Staff”
Reviews.Author: Step W
Reviews.Content: This hotel revalues our impression to Italy or even Europe! The staff in Yes Hotel is so helpful that we didn't worry about anything in Rome. We were warm-welcomed by the reception in this hotel by Mr. Marcello, one of the most helpful staff in Yes Hotel. He clearly explained the locations, sightseeing spots, transportation, fees and itinerary to us and helped us to carry our luggage to another building us a door next to the reception, which has 2-4 stairs before entering our rooms. He could even speak fluent English, so we could communicate with him easily. Btw, he knows Spanish too! Apart from the warm greeting when we first arrived the hotel, we also think that the room was nice, which a comfortable bed, neat, clean and tidy room and decorations. We thought it's a pleasure to stay in this hotel. Though it's not a very big room (maybe we booked at the cheapest price:D) but it's definitely a warm, relaxed place to stay. It would be more appreciated if they have bath tub, but we also felt good with the shower! It's so close to the train station and the bus terminal, which only takes 5 to 10 mins to walk to. Also, Termini Station is the centre of Rome, so you can get to everywhere conveniently, even till midnight. The breakfast is alright cause you need to know that variety of choices of foods in breakfast is that not common in Europe. Hams, cheese, breads, tarts, cereals and eggs etc could be found and you can fill your stomach before you start your great journey in Rome! I would suggest you staying here, for a very simple reason: The staff is so helpful and friendly!

Reviews.Title: “yes yes yes”
Reviews.Author: trippaway
Reviews.Content: Great value very good location for metro/trains .Down side bed on the firm side.

Reviews.Title: “very nice and clean hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: ioanna_peraki
Reviews.Content: the room was perfect! very clean,the breakfast was good and the receptionist very helpful!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to the train station”
Reviews.Author: cmp618
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Yes Hotel with three friends in Sept. 2011. The hotel is a short walk, about 2 blocks from the train station, which made it very easy to get to. We just needed a place to stay overnight in Rome before flying out the next morning, so the location of the hotel was perfect - close to the train station that we did not need a taxi and fairly close to the airport. The staff was very helpful with arranging taxi's in the morning, helping us with connecting to the wifi, suggesting good restaurants, etc. We liked this hotel because they offered a room with 4 single beds, which actually turned out to be two separate bedrooms with 2 beds each and the bathroom was large with two separate showers. This was perfect for us. I would recommend the Yes Hotel to other travelers!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: michaela a
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in Feburary 2012. Hotel very clean and the staff on the front desk are extremely helpful and very knowledgable. The hotel is located few minutes from the main train station and buses making it easy to go to the main sights of Rome. Most sights a walking distance. Rooms extremely clean. My only downside with the rooms (and a personal preference) is that the beds are very hard. Excellent value for money in what is such an expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “A excellent base for a short city trip”
Reviews.Author: N_L0GiE
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I booked the YES hotel Rome, primarily on good reviews here at trip advisor. We were not disappointed. The hotel was extremely clean and well furnished, with good sized rooms. I wasn't expecting much from the breakfast but I was presently surprised as a decent spread of food was available and it was very nice. Location wise the hotel isn’t exactly in the heart of Rome but it is close to termini station, the main station in Rome, and is walking distance to all the main sites. For example when my girlfriend and I arrived we decided to walk to the Colosseum and that took around 15-20 minutes at a slow pace. Overall I would recommend the YES hotel to other young couples who want a nice place to stay and don’t mind a bit of walking.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Boodleheimer
Reviews.Content: On quiet side street around the corner from Termini. Very clean hotel and very helpful front desk staff. Because of scheduling we needed to leave early in the morning and couldn't take advantage of the breakfast. Two parents and two older teenagers were comfortable in a quad room containing two twin beds and one double/queen bed. Basic room with TV. No clock or tissues (which worked fine for us, but I mention for other travelers). Bathroom with shampoo, soap and a hairdryer. Free wifi access in the lobby area, but in rooms cost 2 euros/day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: TraceyM_2012
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel. Literally 2 minute walk from main bus and train station so really easy to find. Bus from airport cost 4-6 euros so buy once you land directly with the bus companies waiting outside. Staff couldnt have been more helpful and polite. Very willing to accomodate any requests or questions. Great breakfast selection, kept us going till dinner. Room was very clean with all the things you would need for a break away. Will be reccommending to friends, family and on facebook. Hope to return to Rome again and will definatley be staying at Yes Hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: OzayrO
Reviews.Content: This hotel surprised us. Staff are friendly and very helpful. Room sizes are average and extremely clean. The hotel is across Termini station. Breakfast however was minimal. We definitely will do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Really clean!”
Reviews.Author: charmander
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here for 3 nights. It's a great cheap hotel for a base camp while you explore Rome. Few minutes from the train station (even though it doesn't take long to walk around the whole of Rome! ) the reception staff are always at the desk an really friendly . The rooms are cleaned to a very high standered . Nice a quite at night and you feel safe. We payed 130ish for a double room for 3 nights bed and breakfast. There is a safe and fridge in the room as well :-)

Reviews.Title: “Friendly reception staff; very close to Termini”
Reviews.Author: BridgePlayer_11
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it was handy for Termini station and I was arriving in Rome late at night. The reviews read well and I got a good rate. The hotel was easy to find and the reception staff were extremely helpful. The twin room was comfortable. There was a good selection of food for the buffet breakfast; the coffee and juice weren't great - breakfast drinks were from selfserve machines.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location even better staff!”
Reviews.Author: Katie K
Reviews.Content: this hotel has an amazing location, very easy to get to from the Termini Station and easy to walk or take the metro from to all of the sites of Rome. It was our first time in Rome and we were able to find the hotel no problem. When we arrived the reception staff told us the places we should see, outlined them on a map and how to get there. He also circled them all on the map so we wouldnt forget! He then outlined areas to go to for shopping, eating out, bars, etc. We wanted nice places to go out to eat at night and he told us which area to go to, and recommended a restaurant to go to, making sure we didnt get stuck in any tourist traps. The rooms were small, but very clean and modern and most importantly the bathroom was clean as well. good breakfast which was included. In all would definitely return and would reccomend to anyone going to rome. Amazing value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: mokky
Reviews.Content: For those train hopping in Italy, staying close to a train station maybe a good strategy. This hotel is not far from the main train station. Stazione Roma Termini. There are cheap eats in the vicinity, a underground metro station and also a bus terminus. You can find bus no. 40 there which plies along the route to Vatican City which is not served by the metro. With that you pretty much can cover the whole city of Rome. There is a good breakfast spread. The counter staff are very friendly and helpful which makes you stay all the more memorable and fun.

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: Paul C
Reviews.Content: Always nervous when booking hotels in places I don't know...what is hiding behind the professional photos on the website? - Well Yes Hotel is not hiding anything - very clean, modern, friendly, helpful. Good location for train station (2 min walk) and near to all the sights (15/30 min walk). Free Wifi in the lobby. Cannot recommend it enough. Very helpful staff, when our room smelt of cigarette smoke, they happily moved us to a new room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Heidi B
Reviews.Content: Clean, friendly, and perfect for a short stay - My second stay here and it was actually better than the first ! Decent breakfast as well.

Reviews.Title: “Ok.”
Reviews.Author: mls_82
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to Termini station if that is what you want, however most other areas of Rome are much nicer than this. The hotel is nice looking and clean. Reception staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The breakfast buffet was great. Rooms are nice however I would recommend to ask for another room if you are given one of the three on the ground floor next to the breakfast buffet. We found it quite noisy and too close for comfort to the common area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - no faults”
Reviews.Author: RJL1504
Reviews.Content: Booked through LastMinute.Com, and therefore it was definitely worth what we paid for it! Lovely service, very helpful and swift. The room was beautiful, though a little on the small side, but we hardly spent any time in our room. Large choice for breakfast. A 2 minute walk from Roma Termini, so very handy getting to and from the airport and to use the Metro. However quite far from the central attractions - though we walked everywhere, except the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Great value”
Reviews.Author: Steph N
Reviews.Content: We stayed here back in May for 5 nights. While the rooms were small, we really did not spend much time in the room since we were out exploring Rome. Breakfast buffet was good and plentiful...hospitality was great. The location was perfect for us...we could walk to the train/bus station or to some of the sites in Rome (if you enjoy slightly longer walks). I went running every morning and they pointed me in the direction of the park. Felt safe. Awesome value!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice at great location.”
Reviews.Author: capec0dder
Reviews.Content: While the room was small, it had everything we needed. Everything was extremely clean and spotless. The front desk was friendly and very helpful, specially Marcelo who provided us with good suggestions and tips. The location is great just a short walk from Termini, convenient to the airport train, the subway (both subway lines meet there), and numerous buses. The area is always busy and we felt very comfortable walking to the hotel even later at night. Excellent choice if you are looking for a reasonable priced accommodation in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel in the middle of Rome”
Reviews.Author: LiseDanmark
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely recommendabel. It´s located near Terministation and everything nearby in walkingdistance. It´s neat and very clean. The rooms contains what you need. The staff are polite and very keen on telling about Rome. The breakfast is OK.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value & location”
Reviews.Author: Coconutvendor
Reviews.Content: Less than a five minute walk from Termini station but within walking distance of many attractions, you could not ask for a better location from which to explore Rome. The staff are all very friendly and helpful. Our rooms were modern, quiet, clean and relatively spacious. There is no view from the hotel but otherwise, it really feels like you could have paid 30 euros a night more. The breakfast is nothing special but more than adequate and very convenient. Wireless internet is available but they provide free internet time in the lobby. This hotel is not luxury but very comfortable and far from roughing it; if you are travelling on a budget and want somewhere central to stay, you cannot go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit to Hotel Yes and it's still great”
Reviews.Author: kmstpete
Reviews.Content: Not a 5-star place, but an amazing value. Hotel Yes is modern and clean with a wonderful staff - very helpful and friendly. Best of all it's so near Termini Station making it easy to drop your bags and go see Rome...or any other city accessible by rail. Many good restaurants in the area, too. The rooms we've had were both pretty small, and the shower was snug, but we didn't spend very much time there anyway so it didn't matter. Free wifi in lobby, 2 Euro per day in the room. This hotel is one of the best values in Rome - will stay here again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: reigndeerz
Reviews.Content: after reading through several tripadvisor reviews, we decided that Yes Hotel fulfilled the requirements that we required for our hotel in Rome. These requirements are: 1. Near the train station to facilitate for easy travel to our subsequent cities 2. Reasonable pricing Unfortunately, the hotel took awhile to find, probably due to a lack of preparation and research in directions on our part. Upon arriving though, we were thoroughly impressed by how clean and modern the hotel looked. We had no issues with the cleanliness, nor the size of the rooms. We were further impressed by the free buffet breakfast offered the subsequent morning, given the prices that we had paid for our stay. We stayed for a total of 4 nights, and were also duly informed during one of the mornings of a transport strike that was occurring during the day. The advice offered by the receptionists were also reliable, which made touring Rome alot easier for us. All in all, a good stay :)

Reviews.Title: “Great value for your money close to Termini station”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravelMom11
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in 2 rooms. The rooms were very clean and the location is very convenient to Termini station as well as some of the sights. We actually walked to the Colosseum, Borghese gallery and Piazza Navona with our 2 kids, ages 10 and 13, and they didn't even complain that much. The breakfast was very good and the front desk was very friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice near train station”
Reviews.Author: Jeanette R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Yes Hotel for one night only, the last night of our two week Italian vacation. We returned to Rome by train and needed a room for one night before flying home. The hotel is a very short walk from Termini Station. We followed the directions provided and found it without problem, and didn't think the area was dangerous or scary, as some have mentioned. The desk personnel were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were large by European standards, very clean and nicely furnished. TV had several English channels.The bath was large and well lit. The breakfast was adequate and included in the room price. Although the area surrounding the hotel is not the most desirable location in Rome, it is very convenient to bus, train and metro, so you can get anywhere quickly and easily. We took the bus to the Piazza Navona area at night without problem. Overall, this hotel is a great value for someone not wanting to blow all their money on a hotel room that they will likely be in very little, but still wanting a nice room. You're in Rome! Who wants to stay in the room??

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and quite nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Faraz S
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and good size. Staff were friendly and courteous. Breakfast was very good with a lot of things to eat. We used to stuff ourselves. 5 mins walk to the Termini station. Overall a very good value. Internet was free at the lobby and 2 Euro per day at the room.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the Best Location”
Reviews.Author: eloise_freeze
Reviews.Content: The cleanliness, staff, and location of this hotel were perfect. I think the beds were tempurpedic, they were so comfortable. Breakfast was wonderful, and plentiful. A bit difficult to find, but once there, absolutely perfect. The staff made us feel most welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: larnerdarren
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay at this hotel and was very impressed. My partner had booked it for our anniversary and it was a great choice. We were upgraded to a triple room and there was a bottle of wine waiting for us, with the compliments of the hotel. The location was excellent for the Termini train station, just a short walk, but was situated on a quiet street and was quiet and peaceful. The room we had 209 was not large, but was very comfortable and tastefully decorated. The Bathroom was compact too but again very stylish and modern. Good shower, nice toiletries. There was a fridge in the room which was useful. The bed was quite firm, but we both slept well after long days of sightseeing. The breakfast was a little disappointing. It was a continental, with a few cooked items, but wasn't great. The juice was very artificial and I don't like coffee out of a machine, especially in italy. The staff however, were great. The hotel was very clean and we found Marcello, who I think may be the duty manager very helpful. He gave us a map and marked on it a good route to see the best of Rome in what was a fairly short weekend. He also gave us some very good tips for places to eat. All in all a very good hotel and I would recommend it and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - excellent value”
Reviews.Author: jamie314
Reviews.Content: Great location, Beautiful hotel, friendly staff -- our best hotel experience in Italy by far. Quiet and modern. Small bathroom but sufficient. 100% recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: bagladycaire
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! Great location in a nice quiet street about 5 minutes from Rome Termini station. The staff are fantastic, very friendly, welcoming and helpful and of course, fluent in English. The hotel is lovely, really stylish and well designed, and the rooms are a decent size for Rome. Our room had a good shower, and a bath, which I'd requested, so that was a nice bonus. Breakfast was really nice, coffee and juice from a machine, but decent quality, and there was a good selection of fresh pastries as well as scrambled eggs and bacon. Wifi has fast and a good price, we paid €5 for our 2 day stay. We'd highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, did the job”
Reviews.Author: BrusselsBassie
Reviews.Content: As most reviewers seem to agree, this definitely is a nice hotel for a stay in Rome. Staff is friendly, rooms are comfortable and clean. Location is quite good, close to the station. I say quite good, as there's no such thing as a perfect location in Rome, in my view. Wherever you stay, you'll always still be far away from some of the attractions. And as the metro-network only covers a part of the town, you'll have to do plenty of walking whether you like it or not. The good thing about being located close to the station is that you can easily get there from the airport, and vice-versa. Area is definitely OK & safe.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Michael W
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with excellent staff. Great location just 2 blocks form central train station and metro. Very modern and quite rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Well run, modern hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: EastCoastPerson
Reviews.Content: Very satisfied with our stay. This is a well run hotel in a very convenient location. Staff was polite and helpful. Decent value for good basic service

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring historic Rome”
Reviews.Author: CandBSuffolk
Reviews.Content: I'd read that some hotels near the Termini station could be noisy, not the case with the Yes Hotel. Modern, good sized clean roomand friendly staff . My only criticism would be artificial tasting fruit juices on offer at breakfast. However the rest of selection was good and overall the hotel offers very good value for money for a central city hotel and would defo stay there again on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “YES, YES, YES Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PMAL
Reviews.Content: We had booked a triple room for 3 nights. The hotel is 5 minutes from the Termini station in Rome and thus an ideal starting point for ALL tourist attractions. The hotel is completely renovated in a design style. There are no big name tag, but for us as very easy to find it. Reception staff are very friendly and knowledgeable English. The room is very, very nice, with comfortable beds. All very very clean.Flat screen TV with national and international programs. The breakfast menu is a surprise with lot, lot of things to eat! Therefore: For the really very reasonable price a TOP recommendation! BRAVO YES Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ladya
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from this hotel and it was just as everyone has said. It was very clean, good staff, and the breakfast was better than I imagined. I found it was lovely to retreat to after a hectic day touring the city. My room overlooked the courtyard so did not have any views and was a bit dark but it was very quiet which was good. The only other thing was someone said there was plenty of hanging space for clothes so I didn't take any spare hangers as I usually do. I would do in future as there were only 2 each. This is only an issue if you have more clothes than hangers ( I like to have lots of clothes). I felt safe walking around at night and there always seemed to be people around-many with maps and suitcases. I would certainly have no hesitation in returning to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could ask for”
Reviews.Author: gabstar73
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel! It is not expensive. It is clean has lovely staff,the rooms are comfortable and provides you with an excellent choice for breakfast. The hotel is in a nice area and very near the station which is handy. What else could you ask for? I will stay here if I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Easy, comfortable, friendly”
Reviews.Author: Francis700
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff here are really great. Very friendly and helpful with questions and suggestions. The rooms are very adequate for the price range and the location is superb, near to Termini Station. Internet was 5 Euros for the entirety of the stay (3 nights). Expect to pay 8 Euro hotel tax that everyone who stays in Rome must pay. Breakfast is included (nothing fancy, but it will get you through till lunch). Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Astello39
Reviews.Content: Three words sum it all - clean, comfortable and convenient. Yes Hotel is located very near to the Central Termini, convenience store and eateries. It is a 5-10mins walk away from the city hop-on-hop-off bus stop as well. The rooms are of a decent size and well maintained. Breakfast is decent and service staff is friendly and helpful. Suggest taking the airport bus instead of the cabs to the airport - the pick up point is also just round the corner of the hotel. Just ask the front desk to point you to the pick up point.

Reviews.Title: “Updated hotel near Termini”
Reviews.Author: StephTodd
Reviews.Content: We picked the Yes Hotel based on both Trip Advisor reviews as well as reviews on the European Destinations website (we booked a Paris/Rome trip through them). Very close to Termini. It was a nice, updated hotel. Staff was nice, breakfast was good, room was a good size with a large wardrobe. The staff recommended a nearby restaurant (can't remember the name) but it's a very small, family-run restaurant just around the corner. Go. You won't be disappointed. Staying near Termini, while not as nice as other neighborhoods, is very convenient. Be sure to check out the small grocery store in the station--you can get some good deals for your stay or to take home. We'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, Yes, 100% Yes”
Reviews.Author: moonin
Reviews.Content: Firstly the location is spot on – an 8 minute walk from the back entrance of Central Termini to the hotel door (situated on a quiet street). We got the ‘Terravision’ bus from Ciampino Airport to Central Termini for 4euros single/8euros return. Don’t waste money on taxis as the option with ‘Terravision’ or ‘Sitbus’ (which stop directly outside the airport and leave very frequently) is so easy. From first entering the hotel, you find a very clean, well organised and friendly place. The receptionist was ultra nice & helpful. There are large maps ready for visitors to take (we found ours invaluable when taking in the sites) Also, any questions you may have are answered and directions given. First class service, couldn’t fault this. Breakfast was fantastic with a selection of hot food (bacon, scrambled eggs, mini sausages & hard boiled eggs) the selection of cold meats & cheeses were replenished immediately they were running low. There was cereal, croissants, toast, buns……everything for a really hearty breakfast. Also, when asked for a take-away breakfast for our last morning to take on the train with us to Perugia, we were given a paper carrier each & told to take what we wanted for our trip. This hotel is so central & because of it’s proximity to the Termini for buses/metro/trains it was ideal for going back to after a moorings’ sightseeing for a rest, lunch & a cuppa before starting off again in the afternoon! There is a lift to all floors and a card key for your door. Room was well decorated and adequate space for us with 3 single beds & quality linens. There is a fridge, flat screen television and plenty of hanging space (even for 3 ladies!) The only slight peeve is that there is no tea/coffee making facilities. We were staying 3 nights and had hold luggage, so I was able to bring my own kettle, coffee/tea. When we asked for cups for our room, no problem, they were given with a smile. If you turn left on exiting the hotel and walk about 10mins, you will get to a supermarket where you can purchase milk, water etc. Decent prices for the basics. There are water fountains around everywhere which you can drink from or fill up your water bottle. This is spring water & safe to drink. It is cold & refreshing as you wonder around in the heat. Also it is free and will save you buying the overpriced small bottles. I could go on & on about the Yes hotel & Rome, but I think you can get the drift……. Yes Hotel is a perfect choice for your sightseeing trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: weezie68
Reviews.Content: We booked two quadruple rooms for the beginning of August at the Yes hotel in Rome. It was within walking distance from Termini station. Although it was small, it was clean, very modern and elegant, the beds were comfy and the breakfast was great, with a variety of hot and cold items. My husband loved the espresso, which he is usually picky about. The cappuccino and the warm cornetto (croissant) was delicious. It is very difficult to find quadruple rooms in Rome, so we booked way back in March. The rooms were air conditioned and very clean--there was also a small fridge in each room. We did not know about the fridge...next time we will bring our own drinks--buying from the bar after hours can get very costly. Our rooms, thankfully, were adjacent to each other. The elevator was beside our room and this bothered me at first, but we could never hear it--it was such a quiet room! Wi Fi was only 5 Euro for our two night stay--which is great when you are travelling with teens. There was a computer in the lobby for guests. Full washroom with tub and shower, hair dryer and bidet for anyone who is interested. It was well worth it....and did not cost much compared to other places that we were looking at. The family that travelled with us asked where on earth we found this place--they were all very,very pleased. The conceirge was very helpful and provided us with a great map of Rome, and described all of the bus routes to all of the main sights. At first, we had difficulty finding it, but it took a simple phonecall, and it just turned out that we were right next to it. It does not have a sign that stands out--when you see the Hotel Jamaica, you're right there at the Yes hotel. . Next time, my husband and I may just travel alone, and we would gladly return to Yes Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “yes ... why not”
Reviews.Author: steelstomach
Reviews.Content: The hotel was small but that's to be expected. Nice concierge, decent breakfast and clean room (small, but clean). Good safety as well. Great location right next to the train station which was great for coming and going to other cities. Walkable (but I'm in decent shape) to MOST attractions in the city. I'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Close to termini, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zeynepthegezgin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at that hotel during our round trip in Italy. Rome was our last destination. the hotel is small but new and very modern. It's close to the main terminal (apr. 7-8 min walk) but it's not near city center so you always have to take the train. And at nicht the area is empty so you should not return to the hotel very late. The rooms are clean, well decorated. The breakfast was satisfying, the mini restaurant was clean. It was easy to access internet for our flight check-in. and the front desk is very friendly and helpful. So you can can choose in this expensive city this small hotel cause the value is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Lisa N
Reviews.Content: I can't think of any negatives about this place. The rooms were modern and clean. All the staff were so friendly and helpful and proactive. The location was one street back and parallel to the central station. The area/street isn't as 'scummy 'as some people have rated it. It was exceptional value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Sparkiling, friendly and excellent value close to terminii”
Reviews.Author: Cookster_11
Reviews.Content: A small, friendly hotel which is a very short and easy walk from the terminii. The room was clean and bright. The whole hoetl apeared to have been refitted 2-3 years ago and everything was in new condition. It was nice to have a sarkling bathroom which didn't smell bad, Air-com that worked properly and and a good range of international plugs. The room was serviced daily and also opened out onto a clean tidy small courtyard. Breakfast was included and had a good selaction of hot and cold. Wifi was 2 euro/day or 5euro per stay. An excellent experience that is in stark contrast to 3 previous stays at different hotels. Will use again when back in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A great option for a short stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: KS33
Reviews.Content: On our first visit to Italy, we only had two days in Rome. The hotel location is very convenient for those traveling by train, as well as for exploring Rome either by bus or subway. The people at the reception desk were VERY nice to us -- gave us quick access to our room and then later took time to tell us about our location and how to get around the city. The neighborhood is fine -- we felt safe at all times of the day. The room for 3 was tiny but well appointed and spotless; we were situated at the back overlooking the courtyard which was very quiet. (The AC works quite well as long as the key card is in its slot and the window is closed.) Breakfast was typical fare -- we augmented it with fresh fruit from the market at the train station. This was the least expensive hotel we stayed in over the course of two weeks and perhaps our favorite in terms of service and value.

Reviews.Title: “Good value with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: bron1960
Reviews.Content: The Yes Hotel was chosen by me because of its location to the Statione Termini. We were warmly welcomed by Marcello. All staff were very friendly and the service was great. An example is when I arrived after breakfast had closed. Maria made sure I still had everything I needed. The Yes Hotel had lifts and good airconditioning. The bathroom was fine. Overall, my daughter and I were happy with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Cyberninja
Reviews.Content: We stayed there with our 2 teenagers (august 4th to 9th). The Hotel is rather basic but very clean and our quad room (101) was rather spacious all things considered. The breakfast was better than we expected and the service from the staff was excellent. My main issue is with the location and the lack of subway service after 9:30. It makes it difficult to have a late night without resorting to taxi service (which are extremely dishonest in Rome). Termini station is no more than 3 minutes away and there are some decent restaurants close by. Cyber

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: juanita7_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Yes Hotel in June with my family and my sisters family. The hotel is great, clean, rooms are very good and great breakfast. We were very happy with the hotel its so close to Termini Station so location is very good you can take the train and bus to get around the only problem is that its on the wrong side of the train station. We had homeless people around, it was dirty and at night was not so great. The other side of the Termini Station is so much better and has restaurants close by. You will also need to pay a daily tax fee per person when you check out.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, good location”
Reviews.Author: Travelfever64
Reviews.Content: We had a family room on the second floor. Stylish, clean and comfortable. Staff was very kind and helpful. Breakfast nice, continental with an Italian touch but even eggs, bacon etc. Good location close to the train station, central bus station, airport busses und underground. Still, various times we just walked, everything is within walking distance, but with children we often decided to take the bus back. Enjoyed Rome a lot. Hope you will as well!

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: Helen K
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June 2011 and were disappointed right from the start. First and foremost the location is terrible. It must be in the dingiest and dirtiest part of Rome. Secondly, reception tried to give us a room off the street as opposed to a room above reception. We didn't feel safe enough to want this. Our time was also wasted as we had to wait around reception for a room to be made up for us upstairs. Thirdly, every time you wanted to put the air conditioner on/off, you would have to contact reception to do it for you. This was painful. And fourthly, the heating racks didn't work in the bathroom, so if you washed any clothes- they stayed wet. Every other hotel we stayed in Europe had heating racks that worked. Apparently, theirs only work in winter. The staff did try to accommodate our needs. The rooms were clean. However, at then end of the day, I wouldn't come back. There are nicer parts of Rome to stay in for the money we spent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Gem and Close to Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: Always4Travelling
Reviews.Content: This was a great little place with lots of character and modern amenities. The hotel was literally a 2 minute walk from the northern part of Termini Station. We were in walking distance to everything including the metro. The rooms are a bit small, but there are some things that you must sacrifice for a clean and convenient property. The bathroom was very modern and immaculate. The only thing may be a problem are the narrow showers. If you are a larger person, you may have a hard time showering. Other than that, everything was great!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional staff and nice area”
Reviews.Author: Hannibro
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my 2 friends 2 weeks ago and enjoyed my stay alot! We caught several trains and it is literally 2 seconds from termini station. The rooms are fairly small but very comfortable and modern. The hotel is very cute and the staff obviously care alot about giving great service. I am planning to go back in September!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but functional and close to station”
Reviews.Author: mcwcBaku
Reviews.Content: Mixed feelings about the hotel, really. The room was tiny but on the other hand it had everything I needed and was very efficient. It was walking distance from the railway station and from where I wanted to go on business, so can't be faulted on that. It just seemed a bit much to pay for a tiny room - but then, it's Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: SweetPeaVentura_CA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to the termini station making Rome accessible anywhere. It is located on the better side of the station so it felt safe and convenient. It is modern, clean, spacious, and had very friendly staff. These were the best night sleep we had in Europe. Breakfast was a good variety and buffet style.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well decorated & Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Noshe
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Yes Hotel when we visited Rome for 3 days. The hotel is 3/4 mins walk from the central station and the room was clean & nicely decorated. Though the hotel is small but the full hotel was well decorated and clean. The items of daily buffet breakfast were not much but it was enough for a decent breakfast. Reception staffs were also very helpful. I would recommend the hotel for those who will be out most of the time yet if required can stay indoors and relax for sometime. Though the accommodation is not luxuriously big but yet the room decorations are good enough for a person to stay indoor for longer if required. Overall the stay was good and the stay was a value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A convenient & clean budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: yy715
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the last night for our trip in Rome, since we have to catch our early flight, and this hotel is near the couch station, so we chose it. Check-in was a bit slow, but the reception was quite nice, he gave us also a city map and some tips about an art exhibition & activities in town. Room size is quite small, but clean with flat screen TV and a small closet. Amenities was so-so, but I brought some from Cavalieri, so it's okay. The bed was comfortable enough, location quite good, it's near the main train station. I found this area okay, just take care when you walk at night alone, it's an universal rule anyway. Though the price was with breakfast, but we have to leave at near 5 in the morning, so I don't know the quality. Overall it suited our purpose, it took us only a minute to catch our airport couch, and price was 80EUR.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: ivana_beograd
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my family. The hotel is on the excellent location near the Termini Station, in my opinion the best location for sightseeing. Althought I was said that the area around the Termini Station is not safe, I didn't get that impression. Termini is 2 min. by foot, Piazza della Republica is 5 min. away. From Termini and Piazza della Republica, there are metro and bus lines to all major sights. The better way is hiking- all the most important sights are less than 30 min. by foot (except for Vatican). Rooms are comfortable and clean, the hotel is new, tastefuly furnished. The stuff is very friendly, right upon check-in they gave us city map, recommendations for restaurants etc. The breakfast is good, except for bread, which is old. That would in fact be the only complaint I have. The hotel is very good for the price, I would recommend it and would go again.

Reviews.Title: “We will recommend the Hotel it was very good value The Haselums Johannesburg S Africa”
Reviews.Author: haselum
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for three days, lovely, Staff amazing and so helpfull and accomodating so pleasant made our stay memorable

Reviews.Title: “Practical Hotel ... Yes !”
Reviews.Author: Jayanta C
Reviews.Content: Convenient location near Termini Station and 'Hop on Hop off' bus stand. Small hotel but proximity to most sites and station makes up for it. Friendly staff and decent breakfast. Negatives: No free internet ... This side of Termini is quite dirty and not very safe ... with homeless, drug addicts and drunks in the alley near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Great place!”
Reviews.Author: colombian Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. If you want to be close to the train station. I stayed here for a couple of days and since I wanted to be close to the train I thought this was the most reasonable place. The price is right and you get the right amount of attention. The breakfast was really nice too. Just make sure you are not in the west side of the station since it gets very sketchy at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: syng84
Reviews.Content: All three of the front-desk receptionists that we encountered displayed exceptionally warm service, which is a highlight of the stay at this hotel. The quadruple room that we booked was comfortable and elegantly furnished with all the basic amenities that one would expect of a hotel. The space was a bit tight for four people, but space generally comes at a premium in most hotels located in such a central area. The location of the hotel was a huge plus, which is a block from the Roma Termini (central train station with connections to the metro). The breakfast had a good variety of items.

Reviews.Title: “Great Modern, Clean Convenient Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: vincehg
Reviews.Content: Very convenient to the central train station without the noice. Walkable distance to coluseum and a few restaturants. The rooms are pretty spacious, very modern and clean. The staff member who met and greeted us on arrival explemplified what good service and set the benchmark for all those in the hotel industry. He was very polite, cheerful, helpful and could speak english which was handy with my limited Italian vocab. At night I did not feel the area was too bad as usually areas near the station can be seedy which was contrary to this and felt safe to walk around at night. I would higly recommend this place with the overall price, location and facilities provided.

Reviews.Title: “Decent and convenient!”
Reviews.Author: phdgracie
Reviews.Content: This hotel has modern decor and truly matches 3-star standard. Room size is decent, except the shower vestibule is a little small. Nice staff, reasonable internet price (2euro a day or 5euro for the entire stay), no problem with AC in hot June when I stayed, and really convenient location--can't be closer to the Roma Termini. The only thing that bugged me a little bit is that the shower water temperature kept swinging from hot to cold whenever I used it.

Reviews.Title: “YES, we will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: travel23
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and enjoyed the location and room! Angelo at the front desk was very friendly and always eager help out anyway he could! We stayed in a quad room (#300) and it was tight with 4 single beds in there but it worked out fine for the 2 nights we stayed. The room decor was modern and clean, the bathroom was large and had a GREAT shower with hot water and high pressure! This bathroom was the best out of 5 different hotels we stayed at on this trip! The beds were comfortable, pillows were average and in room air condition worked good! We also liked the multi electrical outlet near the desk (euro plugs, 240v, us plug 110v ect). The flat screen TV was large. The breakfast was standard euro fare with a good selection (meats, sweets, pastries, yogurt, juices and coffee) and it was suitable to get your day going! They have a self serve coffee machine that makes an average cappuccino but don't expect anything great. The wifi was free for the first hour and then you had to pay if you wanted any additional time... speeds were pretty slow but good enough to check email. (600k down and 200k up) One of the best features of this hotel is the location to Termini rail station, you are a short 2-3 block walk away!! I would stay at the YES hotel again on my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff, good location and great breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: Ali255093
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights with friends. Great location close to main train station and they provided us with good directions to reach the hotel, very helpful especially at night. The staff were extremely helpful and recommended a great place to eat dinner. The breakfast room was lovely and the breakfasts were great, in fact they were the best we had in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “It is a ok small hotel.”
Reviews.Author: hbhhg
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our Europe trip. We stayed 4 days in this hotel. Hotel is newly renovated and clean. Location is convineint for tourists. But the room we got ( room 101) was facing street and there were people outside talking and laughing every night till 1am which made it very difficult to fall in sleep. We e-mailed the hotel before we arriving asking for a quite room(we read a review here complained about the noise at night) but they didn't do that. Breakfast is not as good as we expected and cold cut meat is canned meat and both orange and pineapple juice are not real juice. We paid $244/night for 2 adults and 2 kids. It is really difficult to find a descent hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, reasonable rate, near Termini”
Reviews.Author: rickdare
Reviews.Content: We chose YES in Rome because of its proximity to the Termini rail station (2 blocks away) and because of it's reasonable $225/nite rate on Skoosh.com. YES was immaculately clean, modern, and well-decorated. Our room, #701, was tiny and located on the ground floor behind the kitchen, but we were happy -- we only needed the hotel to sleep and eat breakfast. It was nice and quiet and private in the back, but it felt like we were in the basement even though we weren't. There was no view (nor was one promised) since the one window had frosted glass. The included breakfast was the usual buffet of breakfast rolls and meats, scrambled eggs, cereal, (watery) juices, coffee/tea -- fine enough to start your day. The front desk was helpful. There is 1 public internet terminal available for 2 euros/day. If we visit Rome again looking to save money, we'll definitely choose YES.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: AdrianFilip
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Rome. Yes hotel is very clean with an excellent staff, specially Maria, which is managed breakfast.By the way, very very good breakfast for an Italian hotel.very clean and modern room.Even if the hotel is located in Termini station area, the street is quiet. Thanks again to all hotel s staff for the professional help.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: VicSunSeeker82
Reviews.Content: Located near the train and metro stations. Very conveinent to get around. Clean modern hotel with great staff and good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: joanne112564
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Yes Hotel in Rome Italy. We chose this hotel primarily due to its proximity to the train station and secondly because it looked upgraded. We were not disappointed at all. Although on the small side (rooms in Europe are generally small), the room is very comfortable, well appointed, and modern. The bathroom as well has been updated. Breakfast was also included and they had a very good spread. Cold meats, cheeses, scrambled eggs, hot dogs, bread, cereal, danish, coffee, tea.... I'm sure I missed some. We were about a 3-5 minute walk to the train station which was very convenient as we had some early morning museum appointments . The front desk staff are always very helpful and friendly. The area is quite safe (we arrived at 10:30 p.m. and walked to the hotel) and have so many dining options available. I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again next time I visit!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel by Train Station”
Reviews.Author: jcisler
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Yes hotel and enjoyed our stay there. The beds were comfortable although the room was a bit small for 1 double and 2 twins. The room and bath was very clean and the bath had a shower door - nice when many hotels in Italy do not. We also had plenty of towels. Our 3rd floor room was vey quiet. The staff was also very helpful as we needed to print some important documents and they let us use the reception printer. The only negative was their internet service was spotty. I would recommend this hotel - it's about a 10 min walk from the train station and in a neighborhood with many restuarants. Note: if you use the laundry service nearby note that this is not self service laundry, but one where you leave your dirty laundry and you return later to pick up your clean clothes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Start to a Lovely Honeymoon!!”
Reviews.Author: xhinadol78
Reviews.Content: Marcello was such a lovely and accommodating person during the first 2.5 days of our honeymoon. He really made the first couple days feel special and treated us very nicely. He was always very proactive in asking us what he could help with, and was very helpful with directions and restaurant recommendations. The rooms were really nice, clean and modern. I would recommend getting the larger sized rooms that were located in the corners. The breakfast was GREAT! They actually had nice eggs, sausage, and some nice add ons.... fruit, yogurt, cereal, espresso, coffee, juice, other deli meats and fruit! Internet for one hour was free, but there was a charge any longer than that. This was really one of the best places we stayed in out of the 4-5 towns we visited, and it was also a really great value!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service and great location for travel throughout Rome!”
Reviews.Author: feibeinei
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Yes Hotel after spending one night in a horrible establishment outside of the city. I found the rates very fair and my room was absolutely adorable. Being an American, I am accustomed to larger rooms, but I was not at all disappointed with the space of my room. Everything was well prepared, clean room, clean bath, etc. I found the staff very helpful especially with directions and suggestions for daily excursions. The breakfast was OK, but considering there are many other places to eat nearby it wasn't a deal breaker for me. I will definitely stay at this hotel again on my next trip to Rome! PS. I was solo traveler and I felt that I was treat just as well if not better than those travelling in groups! And although the Internet service was not free, it was offered at a really low considerable rate than most hotels were offering in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the train station!”
Reviews.Author: smileyrnl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Yes Hotel for a few nights at the beginning of June and were pleasantly surprised. The hotel is literally 2 blocks- 5 minutes walking from the main station which made it extremely convenient. It is hard to find - make sure you don't walk by the tiny sign! The room wasn't huge- typical size for Italy but very high tech. The breakfast had a selection of juices, coffee, cold cereal, pastries, and even a station with cooked eggs and bacon. We were very satisfied every morning. The staff was great though- they put up with our endless questions of the area and spoke moderatley well English. We purchased Wifi by the day- I think it ended up being 2 Euros a day? Overall it was a good hotel at a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: ManojSureka
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our holiday mainly based on its rating & review on TripAdvisor and other factors We have stayed at many hotels over the years, often luxury ones with impeccable details and fantastic designs. Price-wise, this hotel is good deal, but this is not a luxury place. Yet, good value for money, It is the perceptive and friendly service that makes it worthwhile staying in this hotel. hotel is in the city, close to station, and good restaurants are at walking distances

Reviews.Title: “Great location excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: handiv
Reviews.Content: If I would go again, I would stay here but ask for a room off the street. We had the corner room just above street level and it was noisy. Our bed was very comfortable and we found this a great place to stay. They provide a good breakfast free breakfast with the room and even had a couple of hot items.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but could have done better”
Reviews.Author: gjacoby126
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Yes Hotel for six days, traveling with my mother as tourists in Rome. First, the good. The hotel was clean, and in a convenient location only two short blocks from Termini, the main Roman train and Metro station, which made it very easy to get around Rome. While some reviews and guidebooks mentioned this as being a bad area, I never felt unsafe, even walking around after a late dinner, and there are plenty of tasty restaurants nearby. The breakfast was pretty good--cereals, croissants, meats, and several kinds of pastry. However, the little glasses for orange juice were so small that I had to return several times to drink enough. The room, however, was small, even by European standards. Mom and I were staying in a "Superior Double", but it was cramped, in large part because the hotel tried to stuff a Queen bed with a nearby Twin into a room better suited for two Twin beds. As it turned out, Mom didn't get the whole benefit of the Queen bed, because half of it was taken up by her suitcase; there was only space on the luggage rack for storing mine. There wasn't even enough space for someone to be sitting at the writing desk and another to get past to reach the door or the bathroom. I like a firm mattress, but the beds at Yes were the hardest I'd ever slept on, worse than my dorm in college, though Rome is so wonderfully exhausting that I still slept well on the Twin. Service was mixed; the man at the front desk who greeted us at checkin seemed somewhat surly, but others we saw on different days were better. However, for the last 36 hours of our stay, the Internet on our floor stopped working (we weren't the only customers complaining). They refunded us the 5 euros we'd paid for it (their Internet rates were VERY reasonable), but made no real effort to fix the problem. It wasn't a terrible place to stay, but I probably wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “'YES' All we could have wanted and more!”
Reviews.Author: BevfromLeicester
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel in a convenient location, that is clean, provides good service, nice rooms and value for money, then look no further that YES hotel. I had looked for a good hotel for hours on the internet including Trip advisor, but almost all, had some bad reviews. All the YES hotel reviews were good, which was why I booked this hotel. There were three of us in our party and we asked for 3 single beds in a quiet room, which was lovely. The room was an adequate size, which was very modern and the bathroom was very clean with a great shower! The location was ideal for travelling all around the historic sites of rome via the Metro and a good bus service if required. As soon as we arrived we were checked in, the desk clerk was very helpful and gave us a map and outlined all the sites and how to get to them. I'd read on Trip adviser and other sites that Stazione Termini is an unsafe place, but we didn't feel this was the case! We never felt in danger at anytime and I would recommend this location highly. Don't get me wrong it's not the best area, and there is a lot of graffitti, but most people in the area were welcoming and friendly, especially the owners and staff at a lovely Italian restaurant on the same road as the hotel, called Donati which was recommended by the hotel. We liked it so much we went twice and we were only in Rome for a three day trip! The food was lovely and the waiters were very friendly and helpful. Complimentary Limoncello for us on our second evening with them...yummy! We booked our airport transfer with Terravision which for 8 euros each return, was excellent value! I would definitely return to this hotel without hesitation and recommend it to anyone! Rome is a wonderful city and we can't wait to return in the future as there is so much to see, which is impossible to do in so little time! Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Yes, In Deed”
Reviews.Author: rjaggagga
Reviews.Content: excellent value,location to train and metro 2 blocks.Staff is great ,good english,one of staff lived in Naples Fla.bed a little hard but room was good size and all you need and more.My wife and I walked to most all the sites but Metro is 2 blks away.breakfast was good ,computer in lobby.I have used trip adv. many times good reviews have always worked for us and this hotel has them as a value.

Reviews.Title: “Def recommend”
Reviews.Author: slugsm
Reviews.Content: Rome isn't that dear when u get there,but the accommodation is the killer. This is a brilliant 3star in a great location with good staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: John G
Reviews.Content: It took us a little while to find the hotel, it is not well signed and there are a number of others around to confuse you. The location near the station is not particularly interesting but convenient enough for the sites of room. The hotel has been recently renovated and feels new, clean and trendy. Our room was small but adequate, the breakfast moderate and certainly could have been better. The outstanding feature: the staff. They could not have been anymore friendly and helpful, and made staying there a pleasure. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “clean safe stay with family”
Reviews.Author: metalhead18
Reviews.Content: I rented two rooms for 3 people per room. Yes the rooms are about size of my cruise ship but it was modern, clean and safe. The breakfast which was really good.The value of the American dollar makes it expensive to eat in Rome . its high to do anything. The train and bus station is only a 3 block walk from this hotel. We got a hop on type of tour over in that area and it was real easy. They speak great English at the Yes Hotel and since I had never been out of California this was a great fit before my cruise.I paid $1,300 for 2 rooms for 3 nights total on Hotels.com. They have a bar if you need a beer or wine just ask and they will open the bar for you. Very cool.

Reviews.Title: “New, modern hotel with convenient location to the Termini train station”
Reviews.Author: Mayday44
Reviews.Content: This certainly was a very cool, modern looking hotel. Considering how expensive Rome hotels are and this was considered a "budget" hotel I was impressed with how nice it was. The rooms are definitely small (even by Italian standards) but they were very nice, modern and updated. The front desk was very nice and helpful. We checked in on my husbands birthday and when they realized that they gave us a free bottle of prosecco which was very lovely! I have mixed thoughts on the location - you can walk there from the Termini train station which is great but it's not really in a neighborhood with much to see. You need to travel (or walk far) to get to most of the main sites and that can be challenging at times. Make sure you bring comfortable shoes to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “A big YES to the Yes Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: bosbes
Reviews.Content: Last week I stayed at the Yes Hotel for 6 nights and it was great ! I chose this hotel because of the good Tripadvisor reviews and the location, also the interior attracted me. It was everything I expected and the perfect place to rest after overwhelming Rome. It is extremely close to the main train station Termini and from there you can go everywhere by metro, tram & bus. The staff was very friendly and they gave us a map and extra information about Rome's cultural week. A valuable tip because most entrances to highlights were free of charge this week ! Our room was at the back of the building so very quiet. Didn't hear any traffic noise of trains. The church clocks waked us every morning at 7:00 a.m. which was fine. The room is modern, clean, had a flat screen tv with channels in Italian and also TVE, TV5, BBC, MTV and CNN. There are amenities provided: shower & shampoo gel, shower cap and soap. We got clean towels every day and the room was made up every day. Breakfast was great with toast, buns, croissants, donuts, cake, pie, cornflakes, yoghurt, crackers, cheese, meat, eggs, etc. Check out time was 10:30 but they have a luggage room and asked if we would store our luggage for the rest of the day. There are a few minor details, actually not worth mentioning. - the toilet seat was a bit wiggling - the heating system was hard to switch off, but maybe it was me not understanding it - after 6 days of white bread breakfast I would loved to have some brown bread or fresh fruit, because I am a vegetarian there was only sweet/sugar breakfast stuff - the sheets weren't replaced for 6 days Tip 1: make your reservation on their site and pay cash on arrival, this saves you money ! Tip 2: ask the reception for wifi it's free for one hour ! Right after check out they sent me an email with a survey so I wrote these things down and I am sure they will do something about it, because they gave me the impression to do anything to improve their hotel quality. My place in Rome is the Yes Hotel, highly recommended. YES, I would definitely stay there again !

Reviews.Title: “A FABULOUS hotel with lovely rooms and superb location”
Reviews.Author: GG12304
Reviews.Content: A fabulous hotel in the centre of Rome within easy walkable distance of all major tourist attractions. Really friendly staff and internet Wifi was good (1hr free). The breakfastw as delish; meats, cheeses, beverages, juices, cakes, pastries etc. Rooms stunning - cleaned every day up to a super standard and bathrooms come with everyday toiletries. Definitely choose this hotel if staying again in Rome; no faults whatsoever!

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful and pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: totaror
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a location within walking distance to the train station which is nice. The rooms were nice and the staff was great. The main locations we were looking to visit, colosseum, vatican, spanish steps were all a bit of a hike, and I'm not convinced the hotel was in the best location for the price. But it was a great stay. I probably would have skipped the breakfast as it was the same mediocre food we've had at 2 other hotels in Italy. Make sure to ask for a dining recommendation for the afternoon/evening manager at the front desk. He sent us around the corner to the best local food we had on our trip. We ate there 2 nights in a row.

Reviews.Title: “A spotlessly clean hotel close to the central railway station”
Reviews.Author: PWJL
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located close to the central railway station, the central bus station and a metro station. The interior seems pretty new and it is kept spotlessly clean and shiny. Our room was very quiet, of adequate size and nicely decorated. The breakfasts are fine with a choice of hot and cold food. The staff are very helpful. The hotel offers a discount for cash payment on arrival. I offered English pounds on arrival on Friday evening [because the rate was given in English pounds as well as euros when booking over the internet]. I was told that they only accept euros, but they kindly agreed to wait until Monday so that I could change money at the bank and get my discount. Clearly they didn't have to do this. Yes!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the low price turn you away!”
Reviews.Author: cflcouple
Reviews.Content: Fantastic staff, very clean boutique style hotel. I had second thoughts about staying because of the low per night price so I only booked 1 night. We ended up staying a total of 3 nights because the location is perfect, and honestly the front desk workers were amazing! Rooms were a little small, but for 2 people worked out great.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay next to Termini”
Reviews.Author: tringuyen82
Reviews.Content: Stayed w gf and her sister in a double bedroom Pros: Great firm bed Great Location, if you are the type who dont mind using the metro Close proximity to Termini, no need for a taxi or further metro lines to get to the hotel Safe, 24/7 front desk, +electronic safe English speaking staff Decent Breakfast, hot and cold Always Cleaned properly and promptly Modern decore, modern bath, recent renovation? Great value Near a grocery store across the street near several ATMs, (they give a small discount for cash) Cons; our double bdrm was near the elevator bit small for two bds, one bathroom split into two, both with showers, split door not near a 'historic landmark' - hence the value Website bit confusing on the directions, as soon as you exit Termini (the main large front entrance) just take an immedaite right at the street (viale enrico de nicola), continue down the street, straight, take a right on Via Magenta and thats literally it, its on your right handside. Republica is relatively close by.

Reviews.Title: “Say Yes to the YES Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mgg50
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the perfect location. Only 2 blocks from the main train station but located on a VERY QUIET street. Several lovely restaurants within walking distance. We were 3 people sharing a triple (3 single beds) but we did not feel cramped. Very clean, modern hotel with a lovely buffet breakfast. Only improvement could be with the Front Desk staff who were more interested in carrying on their personal conversation then in checking us in. Also observed this on another day when a family with a baby were made to wait to check in while the staff continued their conversation. As a former hotelier, I am very sensitive to this kind of "treatment."

Reviews.Title: “brilliant excellent value”
Reviews.Author: charl14
Reviews.Content: stayed here with family it was so clean very modern. breakfast as much as you can eat was brilliant going back again this year

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: missmetroAtlanta_ga
Reviews.Content: clean, comfortable and safe. One block from the train station and both metro lines. breakfast basic. helpful staff. Very good Del Lomo around the corner. Market and internet cafe nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, you can find a clean, comfortable room in Rome without breaking the bank”
Reviews.Author: michelec
Reviews.Content: Thank you my fellow Trip Advisor reviewers for tipping me to the Yes Hotel. As usual your comments were spot on. PROS * Room - My room was spotless, and the recent renovations are appreciated. Yes the room was small, but if you go to a European boutique hotel expecting to get a Marriott-sized room you will be disappointed every time. Also be prepared to bring your own alarm clock and iron as the room had neither (again common in small European hotels). The bed was VERY firm, which made my back quite happy. *Location - Roma Termini is a very short walk from the hotel. Since I took the train from the airport I was concerned that I'd have to lug my suitcase all over town, but 3 blocks later I was in the lobby checking in. In addition, Termini is the only station in town where both the A and B subway lines stop so it is really easy to get to anywhere in the city. *Service - The front desk staff was very helpful and were more than happy to answer any questions or give you advice on where to eat, what to see, etc. CONS *Breakfast - nothing to write home about at all. A bland European spread with deli meats, cheeses, bread, cereal, overcooked eggs, and mini hot dogs masquerading as sausages. If possible I would recommend skipping the breakfast option when booking. There are plenty of spots at Roma Termini where you can get a cheap and much tastier breakfast. *Location - the Termini area is a little run down, but it's not that bad and I felt perfectly safe walking alone at night. Having said that, if you want a nice dinner you may have to hop on the Metro as restaurants in the neighborhood are few and far between. *Climate control - while sleeping I like the room a bit chilly (65F - 18C), but the thermostat would go no lower than 71F - 22C. Thankfully there was a window I could open so it ended up not much of a big deal. Even with the cons I was very happy with my room. I highly recommend the Yes Hotel and will definitely stay there when I visit Rome in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, easy place”
Reviews.Author: artlover075
Reviews.Content: We found after some troubles this Hotel without a proprer plate outside. It's not a small hotel after all but no signs outside. We walked in and a young asian guy checked us in. Our room was clean and everything was fine. Quite chheap and easy going. Breakfast included and quite abundant.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great city!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lidija10
Reviews.Content: We booked hotel 2 weeks earlier and been there for 7 nights.Staff was so friendly and polite,helped us with everythimg we needed.Hotel was clean,new,nice and comfortable,so we felt really amazing.We had 25 minutes walk to center of the town,so,after the breakfast,we did the touring,and in the evening,we came to hotel with metro,only 2 stations from center.Hotel is 2 minutes walking from Stazione Termini,so you can do trips with train on daily bases.Nice combinations for breakfast,nice room and bathroom,everything was great.I would recommend this hotel always,and,when I come back in citta eterna,try to stay here again,for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, really close to the train station!”
Reviews.Author: MrSilv
Reviews.Content: The only negative comments are that the shower was hot/cold on occasion, and the room heater would come on even though I switched it off! But I would stay again and the location is perfect if you want to be able to access the main train station (Termini) and the underground.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, tasteful decor and atmosphere, excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: WyomingKate
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for location, reputation (in Fodor's!) and value. It was a wonderful base for our 7 days vacation. The hotel was tastefully decorated and clean in every area we saw. Rooms were ample and comfortable-we had a double and a triple. Daily breakfast presented a variety of foods both warm (bacon, eggs) and cold (yogurt, cereal, pastries), including deli meat and cheese for a cold sandwich.
