After breakfast, we toured each day and didn't really need to eat again until evening. The staff were friendly and spoke fluent English-they provided information regarding the area, served us wine from the hotel's private bar. internet access charges were minimal-wireless network performed without problems. Location was excellent-within 2 blocks of Termini entrance-providing access to buses and metro which were easy to navigate. Termini has many shops, including a grocery which was amusing for our teenagers and allowed us to pick up snacks. We have no negative comments to offer-we were completely charmed by and pleased with our experience there. My husband wants to return to Rome and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely YES to Yes hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kirkou
Reviews.Content: Couldn't recommend it more! Very clean, new or recently renovated, with well-tasted modern furnishings and fabrics. It is located just outside Termini station where you can find buses and metro for everywhere in Rome. About 20 minutes walk from Colosseo or Fontana di Trevi. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly. There is a map at the reception and you can arrange a taxi to the airport if you need it. Breakfast is a very pleasant surprise (for a three star hotel). Tasty pastries, bread, cheese, juice, coffee, espresso, boiled eggs, scrambled eggs and bacon. All very tasty and served in a beautiful environment. We got the best price through hotel site and we paid even less because we paid in cash when we arrived. You get a 3 & 1/2 star hotel treatment at the price of a 2 star hotel. Just AMAZING!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms with fair location”
Reviews.Author: UFPA10
Reviews.Content: Hotel is modern, clean, fresh. The location is near Termini station which is vaguely convenient but industrial feeling with homeless people milling around. The hotel has great security but I would recommend looking for budget hotels around the Spanish Steps area (ie: Hotel Condotti). The Spanish Steps themselves are extensively overrated but the area is really wonderful to people watch, travel to other areas or shop even.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience!”
Reviews.Author: CANJ83
Reviews.Content: I never, ever write reviews but I am so thankful for all the reviews before me as they were so helpful, I feel compelled to share my experience. Yes Hotel is the BEST location. If you plan on using the Metro to get around Rome (or out of Rome) Yes is literally one block from the MAIN train station and metro station (Termni). This was fantastic because we flew into Rome and took the bus directly to Termini Station and were only one block from the hotel (after a very long trip from California, we were relieved to be so close to a clean bed and shower). The rooms were smaller than I expected, but then again it is Europe and most rooms are tiny. The room was very tastefully decorated and the bathroom was VERY nice for a "budget" hotel. Breakfast was excellent as well for a budget hotel. It was more than just croissants, coffee, and juice. It had fruit, cereal, yogurt, cheeses, meats, and of course pastries/toast. It had a few juices and coffee as well. So overall to have a nice, spotless, modern room, free breakfast, and so close to the main train station you cannot get better.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect base from which to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: Kingpolo14
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern and functional, but very clean; reception staff were very helpful and spoke very good English; the breakfast buffet is extensive (maybe the toaster was a bit on the temperamental side...), the beds were very comfortable, the room was big enough. The Via Magenta is a quiet side street, which means that noise isn't a big problem and one can get a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay in YES hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wang75
Reviews.Content: The reception staffs were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast were good and with various choices. Room was clean, warm. The only problem is "cups", you could not find a glass or cup for drinking purpose. All were plastic ones in the restroom.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: campbellf2008
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located within a couple of blocks if you are arriving at Roma Termini, which includes the Terravission transfer from Ciampino Airport. Rooms are small, but modern, clean and functional with all the basics you would need for a short break. The staff are extremely welcoming and have excellent English if your Italian is not up to scratch. Breakfast is fine and provides a great way to start a long days trecking about Rome's highlights - coffee and pastries are very good. There are probably cheaper hotels, and hotels nearer the attractions, but for a short break I would certainly recommend the Yes Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: VLYC
Reviews.Content: + good location, 7 mins walk to Roma Termini. Easily accessible to all parts of Rome using the train. + room is clean. + staff tried hard to accomodate request. - no visible signage of hotel. it is located under an old hotel new york signboard. - was not given the room of my choice upon booking via booking.com. Also had to change room. The second room had a door that cannot be locked. This door leads out to a courtyard. Does not give security comfort to women traveller. Had to change room for the second time. - room that faces the street can be noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: seagullrob
Reviews.Content: We were travelling around Italy with 3 other couples, spending time in Rome, Venice, Tuscany and the Cinque Terre. We chose this hotel for our last, stopover, night in Rome, having arrived in Rome by train from Venice in the afternoon on our return journey, and due to leave Rome airport the next morning. Thus, it was really only a place to sleep for one night. Proximity to the railway station (Rome Termini) was a priority, and the location of this hotel was brilliant in that regard. It’s easy to find from the Termini train station using a standard tourist map of Rome, once you work out where you have exited the huge Termini. It also means that getting around Rome itself, whether by the underground Metro system or by bus (including the open-top double decker tourist buses), is easier – just go to the Termini for the outgoing journey, and make sure that your return trip is also going to the Termini. The reception staff at the Yes Hotel were friendly and helpful, providing maps and arranging for a maxi-taxi at a given time. Check-in was prompt and efficient and our rooms were all ready. Booking and payment over the internet was straightforward, and we got a good deal price-wise in this way. The room (and ensuite), though small, was clean, comfortable and air-conditioned. No complaints in this regard. The self-serve breakfast, which was included in our room rate, was a bit disappointing. The juices were powdered, whilst the hot food (scrambled eggs, beef bacon and little sausages) was cold, as were the hard boiled eggs (we were eating at 8.00am; it has probably been put in the tray at least an hour beforehand). Cold boiled eggs you can handle – you eat them in salads; not so bacon, sausages and scrambled eggs. The yoghurt was dispensed through an ice-cream machine, and was a bit watery but not too bad with the tinned fruit. There were pre-packaged pastries, cereals and you could make toast. For a country that thrives on coffee, the coffee from the vending machine was a huge disappointment – some found it undrinkable; instant would have been better. I know I’m harping on about the breakfast, and in fact, apart from the cold hot food and terrible coffee, it was quite serviceable, especially for the price. I’ve had worse in the US. They should probably drop the hot food option – better not to do it at all than to do it badly. For the price, no one would criticise them for not having bacon & eggs; but you deserve to be scolded for serving up cold food. If you ignore the breakfast (be selective in your choice or eat somewhere else), this was a good hotel, well located, reasonably priced, with small but clean and comfortable rooms. It suited our purposes and in the same circumstances, I’d stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, easy location”
Reviews.Author: kmstpete
Reviews.Content: If you're traveling to Rome by train it's super convenient to stay near the Termini station. not the prettiest area, but who wants to haul baggage around the city? The area is full of hotels but in all my many trips this is the nicest I've found. Rooms are new and clean. the shower worked. staff was incredibly nice - a rarity in this tourist-weary city. even breakfast was good - it was nice to have some eggs after a week away. Highly recommend this cute place.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Yes Hotel in Rome for 2 nights in September and were extremely pleased. The Yes Hotel is very modern, up-to-date and very hi-tech. It was exceptionally clean and a gem in the heart of the Rome Termini Station area. A very short walk to the station. Everything was close by and we did not require the use of any public transit, just walked everywhere. Breakfast was plentiful with lots of choices. The staff are very friendly and helpful. We will definitely return to this hotel on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely more than a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rachel_B_Zurich
Reviews.Content: Great location, right by the Rome Train Station, but tucked away in a quiet street. Very helpful staff, very modern, tidy room, newly renovated with a lovely bathroom. Breakfast was good too - one of the best I've had at a 3* hotel. Only complaint (albeit very minor), was that the coffee at breakfast was awful, but everything else was great. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: balmoral03
Reviews.Content: The hotel feels newly renovated and it spotlessly clean. Rooms are comfortable, bathroom is fairly spacious. Wifi was reasonably priced. About 100m from Termini Station. We only stayed one night before going to Sorrento. Stayed in another hotel when we returned to Rome for another 3 nights. The other hotel was near the historic centre, cost more but was horrible and barely 2 star. We should have just stayed in Yes Hotel again. Termini is not the nicest area, but this is a great value hotel for less than 100 euros per night.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly recommended”
Reviews.Author: vezins
Reviews.Content: Friendly helpful staff. Spotlessly clean. Comfortable beds. Great choice for breakfast (even bacon & eggs). Close to Termini station but in a quiet road. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: BecsCheshire
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from staying in the YES Hotel for 3 nights with a friend and we are so pleased that we chose to stay there. The hotel is very modern, clean and the staff are really helpful. It is in a quiet street only a few minutes walk to the Termini and bus stations and we felt safe at night. It is nice to go back there at the end of a busy day sightseeing. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, modern, clean and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: HolmesFamily2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in a family room. The hotel is excellent - clean, modern, extremely helpful staff and the location is great (a couple of minutes walk from the Central Train Station). It is a small hotel but compares very favourably to larger chains but with far better service. My only criticism is the room was small for the four of us (2 adults and 2 children) but the rest of the experience made up for this. The breakfast was good, and even though space is limited, choice was good and excellent coffee! I would definitely reccomend this hotel and given its central location in an expensive city, I think it was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nicer than 3 stars”
Reviews.Author: mdphdbfd
Reviews.Content: We had 2 triple rooms for 6 people. The staff were exceptionally helpful, especially Marcello! The hotel was very nice for a 3 star rating - the neighborhood was a little sketchy, but it's close to the train station, so what can you expect. We were out only until 10:00 pm, and it didn't feel unsafe at all at that time. The church bells going off at 7:00 am were a great wake up call - all 38 chimes! Great b'fast, good internet value (5Euro/day). Would definitely recommend and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The staff made the hotel great”
Reviews.Author: philf0rfun
Reviews.Content: The Yes hotel is very close to the main train station in Rome, well within walking distance. Very standard accommodations with clean rooms; small bar which sells water, beer and coffee; breakfast is served until 10am which is a little early for me unfortunately. The staff here was amazingly helpful and polite as I was massacring the Italian language. The gentleman who worked the night shift, Matteo, was always able to point us in the right direction for late night food and great bars. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short trip into Rome”
Reviews.Author: Canadianfamily65
Reviews.Content: Hotel is modern with plenty of room for family of 4 (2 separate shower areas in the bathroom).Beds were comfortable and room very quiet. Front desk was manned 24hrs and all the staff were friendly and professional. Breakfast was included and nothing was lacking. Hotel is only about two blocks from the train and metro stations (ignoring google instructions). If limited time in the city, there is also a Hop on/Hop off bus that departs just outside the train station(again just around the corner from the hotel) that gives a decent highlight tour of Rome's main sites in about 2 hours.

Reviews.Title: “There are better options”
Reviews.Author: Kylie10
Reviews.Content: Pros: The hotel was clean, it was a short walk to the train station, and the breakfast staff was very nice. If you prefer a more authentic area, you will probably like it. There are very few tourist walking in the area and at the two or three surrounding restaurants. Cons: The area from the train station to this hotel is not a good and I would hesitate being in there at night without my husband. If you went a few more miles away from the train station, the area is much nicer and about the same price. Restaurant options were limited. The front desk was below average on their willingness to assist us. This was also the smallest hotel room I had ever seen!

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel. Great location, very comfortable. Great for families.”
Reviews.Author: bub119
Reviews.Content: We ended our Italy trip with three nights at this hotel and couldn't have been happier with how it worked out. In the intense heat of Italy's summer, this hotel actually believed in real air conditioning. The room for our family of four was great.--two separate bedrooms with very comfortable bedding and a small refrigerator in each room. The location close to the Termini train station ( two blocks) made getting around Rome very easy with plenty of restaurants (and gelato) withing walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base to Explore ROME - But very small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Nisha-London
Reviews.Content: This is a good location to expore the sights of Rome. The hotel is clean and modern. The Metro is 2 minutes away, only costs 1 euro to get around. The sights are all very close togther, about 2 stops away from the hotel. If it wasn't so hot, we could have walked to the sights. Breakfast is basic, but good for thr price we paid. The front office staff are very helpful and room was cleaned to a high standard everyday. The rooms are very small, but I think this is typical of rooms in Rome. The shower cubicle is also tiny. No iron or iron board in the room, but very good air conditioning and fridge. (No minibar) For the price we paid this is a good hotel, as you will only spend a little time in the room and most of the day and night exploring wonderful Rome. Overall a very comfortable stay ain a modern hotel, would highly recommend, good value in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Very safe hotel”
Reviews.Author: jtraveltheword
Reviews.Content: i have been a guest in yes hotel a couple of times : first in 2008(2009) and then, the 2nd time in may 2010. I've had a great experience with the staff and the hotel as a whole,and if i ever go back to rome i will (definitely) stay there again . in fact i was about to write a review when i came across the comment titled "a violent crime" and i felt i had to give my opinion since i was there when everything was happening. i happened to be in the reception area for a while using the internet while the whole thing was taking place and i can tell you that i would be a stretch to even call it a crime . it was an accident like you can find in any big city everyday. so inquiring about the situation the receptionist the kind angelo explained me about it and i can say he was very proactive working with the hotel across the street calling the police taking care until the police arrived , and soon everything was back to normal . it's not fair though to damage the image of the hotel and the staff. the area might be a bit sketchy at first sight (keep in mind the main train station is just around the corner) but personally , i felt it was safe enough for my girlfriend to go out on herself any time . the perks of being in a well-located hotel outweigh any preconception you might have about what is, in the end a very safe area and a very safe city . i guess the proof is the international crowd you find every night taking a walk or dinning merrily and carefree at midnight or beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Clean and Modern - Not the best sleep.”
Reviews.Author: inbetweenthesedays
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, we had a heavy bag and took a taxi - DON't, it is a two minute walk from Termini and we were ripped off by a 20 euro cab driver (and as I questioned him he claimed not to speak English!) Any, the hotel. Excellent Staff! The breakfast is OK... don't be later than 10 though! The rooms are very clean and modern. There is no ENglish television, but you're in ROME so explore! My only real complaint was that there was no iron in the room and you have to go to reception and iron in the luggae room, and the beds are not comfortable, very hard and onlyo ne pillow each provided. We were in room 601 on the ground floor which did suffer from Road noise. But in terms of Rome it was a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Helped us in a pinch. Plus safe, clean, amenities, location, and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: kmulrain1013
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Yes hotel for the first 4 days and loved it. Breakfast was included, staff is friendly and helpful, and the hotel is clean and very modern. I travel a lot but was immediately impressed. When we returned to Rome from Naples, this hotel wasn't available so we stayed at another down the street. The difference was immediately apparent. The new hotel had a tiny 2-person elevator, there were three hotels in one building, you had to pay for air conditioning, no internet, no breakfast, bugs, AND some of our stuff was stolen from within the hotel (including passport). In a panic, we actually went back to the Yes to get advice on what we should do - at 5 in the morning, they were more help than anyone else - even the police. Thank you to Matteo at the Yes Hotel. Without you, I don't think we would have caught our flight. 5 stars without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: snooperdooper
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice and clean hotel... Modern with a great staff and in a good location... Would recommend this hotel to any traveler...

Reviews.Title: “Italy with a Splash of the U.S.”
Reviews.Author: Roxi7
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel was impeccable! The gentlemen at the front desk were extremely helpful with directions and advice on restaurants. Since we arrived on an early flight from the U.S., we were able to store our luggage in a locked room and go sightseeing until our room was ready. They also let us use the main floor restroom facilities to change clothes. There were four of us, and our room was quite spacious (especially for Europe). The bathroom was very large, as well. The room was clean, and the rest of the hotel was clean. Overall, the hotel is more similar to ones in the U.S. than the usual ones in Europe. Breakfast was continental, but it was sufficient and tasted good. The location of the hotel is ideal because it's located in a quiet neighborhood that isn't crowded with tourists. The Termini Station is only two blocks from the hotel, so it's easy to jump on the subway or the train to anywhere you want to go. Our favorite part about the hotel was the friendly staff and clean facilities. We couldn't really find anything wrong with it! The only bad part, for us, was that this was the first place in Italy we stayed, so we compared our other hotel stays to this. Needless to say, none of them matched up!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: cebuanaflorida
Reviews.Content: conveniently located near the Termini station, had issue with bathroom (shower enclosure doesnt close well), breakfast is great

Reviews.Title: “Fab, modern hotel with friendly staff & excellent location!!”
Reviews.Author: Sam270
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Yes Hotel just last week & we had such an enjoyable stay we just had to write about it!! The hotel is located near the Termini Station which provides easy access to the airport. A lot of tour buses start at the Termini so you can easily commence your tour of Rome from here too! The hotel itself is just two mins walk from the Termini, so no taxi needed! The decor is fresh, modern & exceptionally clean and the staff would do absolutely anything for you. We were travelling with our 15month old son & they were incredibly helpful with anything extra that we needed for our room. Our only little snag was that the room did not have tea & coffee facilities which would have been handy for warming bottles but as I mentioned the staff were incredibly helpful to us so not a problem really! You can also get tea & coffee from the bar if need be! On arrival, the staff provided us with a really useful little map showing the nearest restaurants, ATMs, pharmacy etc - everything you need really which I thought was a lovely little touch! They will also arrange a taxi service from the hotel to the airport on your way home, for just €40. (The train is €14 per person so I'd def say take the taxi, it takes the hassle out of it!) Our favourite activity when we were in Rome was the wine tasting at Vino Roma, an excellent introduction to Italian wines. You can find info about it at: http://www.vinoroma.com/

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel in a prime location!”
Reviews.Author: arsenalfan888
Reviews.Content: After hours of searching for a hotel located centrally, I became dismayed after reading review after review of poor Rome hotels. Then I came across the Yes Hotel... it looked clean and comfortable in the pictures and so I booked it. Wasn't disappointed at all... in fact was very pleased with my choice. Location: It is VERY close to the Termini which is great for getting around Rome, took us about 3 mins to walk from the hotel to the station. Being on a side street it was quiet in our room in a night. Room: We had a standard double room which was spacious compared to the hotels we've stayed in New York, Tokyo, hong Kong and London. It was very clean; sheets and towels were crisp white. Bed was very comfy and pillows were plump. Good amount of storage space. Staff: Very helpful and courteous. No complaints at all. Downsides? In all I don't have any complaints with the hotel at all, the only issue was our aircon didn't seem to turn on, but then it didn't really bother us since it wasn't that hot and there were two very big windows we could open. Might have been an issue though if we had visited in July or August.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in the Eternal City”
Reviews.Author: OregonWalkabout
Reviews.Content: If you don't want to drive in Rome (who would?) a hotel near the train station is ideal. The Yes hotel is just around the block from the Rome Termini. We were able to connect to the subway, to the train for a day trip out of Rome, and to the Leonardo Express for transit to Fiumicino and our departing flight. The staff was beyond helpful, even shared a pizza delivery on a rainy evening! We spent more for this hotel but for the sake of convenience, it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: mimigidget
Reviews.Content: I did a boat load of research on hotels for our trip and this is the one I picked. DIDN'T REGRET IT! It is in a great location. The hop, skip and jump it took to get the Termini everyday was IDEAL. The staff was wonderful and very helpful, telling us about little hole in the wall diners with excellant food and a tour guide office not 2/3 blocks from the hotel. The rooms are a bit on the tiny side, but that didn't bother us...WE WERE NEVER IN THEM! We had a problem with the A/C on the first day we were there, but the Manager called somebody in to fix it ASAP! There was 6 of us all together...we had one single room, one double room (queen bed) and a room with 3 singles, all the rooms were of great quality. we stayed there 8 days without any problems except the AC on the first day! All in all...it was a wonderful stay and I would recommend it to EVERYONE. Including myself when I visit ROME again.

Reviews.Title: “YES - weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Maxi_Mal
Reviews.Content: We have spend wonderful 4 days in this hotel. 1 minute from the Train/Metrostation Termini it's perfectly located for trips through Rome per public transport or to start walking tours to the near placed sights. The rooms are a little bit small but when you are in this town, you will not spend to much time in your room. So the space was enough ... the bathroom looks very modern and the rooms were perfectly clean. The breakfast was a very good and so we had a good start in the day. I would highly recommand this hotel to everyone who is looking for a neat and comfortable hotel which is perfectly located.

Reviews.Title: “small and cute but bad bad location”
Reviews.Author: nutela
Reviews.Content: The rooms are so small.. Me and my partner had to take turns to walk in the tiny corridor that was leading to the bathroom and the exit. The beds are tiny and the mattress made my back heart every night. Some people would like the location, is near a big train station and a metro that would take you from the hotel to almost anywhere in Rome. But in the evening there are a lot of homeless people around the station area sleeping in boxes and asking for money.. Because it is very touristic area it is full with restaurants and restaurants and some more restaurants and that is it. The breakfast is average and the stuff is o.k. I wouldn’t recommend it and I would never go there again.

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice.”
Reviews.Author: 1stepahead
Reviews.Content: We were terrifically happy with our 4 night stay with 3 teenage kids at the Yes Hotel. Rome only has two metro lines, and their only connecting station is at the train station one block from the hotel. So, just about anywhere you want to get to in Rome is easily done. The staff were always friendly, helpful, and easy to communicate with (especially Joseph in the evening). Our 2 rooms were certainly large enough. with towel warmers in the bathroom. Breakfast of rolls, meat/cheese, cereal, coffee and juice was more than sufficient to get us on our way. Safes in the room, similar to safes on cruises, allowed us to lock up our passports and just carry copies for the day. We really couldn't have made a better choice. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: eire01ireland
Reviews.Content: Hotel was excellent. staff were extremly friendly and helpful especially francesco. Hotel was very well located.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: FromBrazil06
Reviews.Content: Yes Hotel is near to Termini Station, offers a good breakfast and has a great staff at the reception. Different from others places, we were very well served by the reception staff. They were smiley, kind and friendly people. "Grazie", guys!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value!”
Reviews.Author: streifelj01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel to start off our honeymoon in europe. The hotel put us in relatively close proximity to the sites we wanted to visit. The staff was kind and helpful. The rooms were small, but that is to be expected in Rome. Although small, the rooms were very comfortable and modern. Everything was clean and comfortable. We recommended the hotel to some friends of ours and they enjoyed their stay as well. The breakfast was great. My husband and I travel quite a bit and were impressed with the Yes Hotel. While not the best hotel we have stayed in, the Yes Hotel was a great value for its contemporary feel, helpful staff, breakfast, and proximity to sites. Yes Hotel was a great start to our wonderful vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Very cool boutique hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: AlexandriaVAAlexVA
Reviews.Content: The design of this small, very conveniently located hotel is very impressive. The rooms are small, but completely and thoughtfully renovated with flat-screen TVs, Europe and US-compatible electrical outlets, bathroom towel warmers, etc. We had two bedrooms (1 double bed and 2 singles) and a shared bathroom with 2 sinks and two showers -- an ideal setup for us (couple with 2 teenagers). Good breakfast buffet with a range of light foods, friendly staff. Excellent location just 2 blocks from the Termini train station and subway system; decent restaurants nearby. The only drawbacks were noise from the street and other guests who were incosiderate, and the breakfast seating area is a bit cramped (again, some of this was due to inconsiderate guests). But overall, this is an excellent place to stay and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Some drawbacks, but a standout staff”
Reviews.Author: xeno111
Reviews.Content: The friendly, effective desk staff distinguished themselves immediately with solid advice and flawless English. Rooms are quite small, even by European standards, but they're also near-spotless with updated design. Thin walls though, so be prepared to hear your neighbor's doings. Breakfast was nothing special. Cold cuts, yogurt, bread and the like. But it's free and more than adequate to start the day. 5 Euros/day to use the computer in the lobby or the wireless network is disappointing. There are a couple internet cafes nearby that offer better value, if less convenience. It's steps from Termini station, which means you're a short walk to an array of buses and both Metro lines. Rome is pretty compact, so if the weather is nice and your mobility good, you can walk to some major sights. There's nothing special about the hotel's neighborhood, but day or night we saw nothing "sketchy" like a previous reviewer described the area. Though we do live in New York, so I suppose it's all relative.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Small Contemporary Hotel in a Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Kotik888
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went on our honeymoon to Italy. We picked the hotel because of it's location (right next to Termini) and good price. The hotel staff was very helpful, rooms were a little small, but very clean. One morning we did not receive the wake up call and the manager of the hotel apologized and gave us a free bus tour around Rome. Breakfast was pretty good, the bread was fresh and good variety of cold cuts/cheeses.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot for Boutique on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: CharlesInItaly
Reviews.Content: YES Hotel is a great boutique on a budget hotel. Modern rooms that are clean, nice decor and of a good size, very nice amenities and a very good location close to Rome Termini (a real benefit for using the vast Italian train systems and local metro). The breakfast was very nice and the staff, while limited, were prompt and helpful where they could be. Overall a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “The ideal Hotel to stay for a holiday in Rome”
Reviews.Author: EmmanuelGalea
Reviews.Content: Its in a prime location, Very clean,good Breakfast,very good staff, Helpful Reception attendants, The lady who take care of breakfast is very polite and the lady who take care of the rooms cleanliness is very helpful. One thing I will suggest to the management is to put a Hotel Name sign which is visible when walking on the pavement towards the Hotel. I am sure that if I will have to return to central Rome I will not look for another Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect :-))”
Reviews.Author: dorgamas
Reviews.Content: Good quality and good price. I stayed a week ago and had a wonderful stay. We welcomed by a very friendly staff. Jonadab and Giuseppe were very helpful and attentive all the time giving us directions and answering all our requests (it was the first time in the Eternal city!). Rooms were spotless and modern styled. Location was terrific: just 5 minutes from the main station. I would suggest definetely to purchase Roma Pass: 3 day-pass for means of transport plus 2 free museum entrances. I would stay definetely again in this hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kmmh58
Reviews.Content: We booked the Yes Hotel from 26-29 November 2009. We arrived at reception @ 11am, and got to check into our room straight away. The front counter staff were helpful and friendly. The room as on the 1st floor (room 104) and there was a view of the back yard, which was not a issue, the decor was modern which was a plus. There room had a double and single bed. The room as clean each day. My partner ate breakfast each morning, he said there was cereal, bread, juice, coffee. There also was a bar in the hotel, although I never seen anyone drinking there. Pro's: Central Location at Termini Station, Clean Hotel, Cheap Rates, Friendly Staff, a locked Luggage hold room (for late departures) Con's: The walls are super thin, we could hear the quests from 2 rooms away from us talking, although this was only the 1st night when we ventured to the hotel early due to exhaustion.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: kegofast
Reviews.Content: This great hotel is on a quiet street just 3 blocks from Termini Station; centrally located for quick access to the train, buses, and metro. The rooms are modern and extremely clean. We enjoyed breakfast everyday before beginning our sightseeing. Our entire family was given rooms next door to each other. An iron is available for use, and internet use is 5 Euros. A gold statue stands on the building nearby making it easy to locate the YES hotel from anywhere closeby. The hotel is a sparkling gem, with a welcoming staff. Even though four days is not enough time to totally see the sights of Rome, YES made our visit easier.

Reviews.Title: “Hip and Cozy!”
Reviews.Author: Unun218
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect, only 5 minutes from the Termini station. The decoration inside the hotel is hip and cozy, with English speaking staff who're friendly and helpful. Breakfast is the best amongst the other 3 stars that I've stayed with.

Reviews.Title: “We give YES a huge YES!”
Reviews.Author: hotpotato6
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome and we wanted a hotel by Termini to make transport from the airport and then to the port for our transatlantic cruise workable by train - and it was. Four nights was not enough to explore this fantastic city, but we sure made the most of every second! Walked and walked some more.....check out tours given by Through Eternity and Eden Walks - 2 great companies that we used for excellent guided tours. Rest of time we explored beautiful Rome on our own by public transportation and, of course, walking - but did leave enough time to eat some fantastic meals and drink lots of red wine! Cannot say enough positive things about the hotel's staff - every question I asked, and there were a lot of them!, was answered with a lot of additional information besides. We found the breakfast most adequate, and the location safe. After a late dinner at a local restaurant one evening we actually walked around the surrounding area until well past midnight. Went to the Trevi fountain a couple of times but forgot to toss a coin in ... however, will return!

Reviews.Title: “Yes Hotel - Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: marxbros
Reviews.Content: Can't really add much to other reviews - just wanted to leave another excellent review

Reviews.Title: “Seemingly high-tech hotel for an old building”
Reviews.Author: lakez34
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located about a 5 minutes walk from the Roma Central Termini train station on one of the small side streets. Although not a short walk to any of the major sights (about a 20-25 minute walk to the Colosseum), tourist attractions are very accessible via the train station. I would recommend this hotel for those willing to stay away from the large crowds while still being able to safely and easily navigate the crazy streets of Rome. The entire hotel seemed to have a high-tech upgrade to it, especially considering the building looked pretty old, with the light switches and electrical outlets all operated by a touch panel near the room's entrance. Bathroom was pretty small but clean and spacious enough to at least move around a bit. Front-desk staff was very courteous and breakfast was included every morning. One point of note - there also seems to be a separate building that's associated with this hotel which is used as a hostel - be sure you know which one you're reserving.

Reviews.Title: “Very near Roma Termini, clean rooms, good service”
Reviews.Author: burabura
Reviews.Content: This was one of the few places that actually gave really good directions to the hotel. It is very near Roma Termini and staff are friendly. I think it was Marcel who attended to me when I checked in and he was very kind to give me a guided tour on paper. A modern hotel but still feels cosy in a way.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget Hotel, good location, clean, friendly, yet small rooms”
Reviews.Author: 2fun2forget
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights before boarding our cruise ship. It was a very reasonably priced hotel. It is located close to the Termini station so you have easy access to the whole city. The rooms are clean, the staff friendly, and you get breakfast everyday. The one down side is that the rooms are very small and there is no storage place in the bathrooms at all. If you know what to expect before then you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,nice price,wonderfull staff”
Reviews.Author: backcourt
Reviews.Content: Clean,comfortable,convenient location at a reaonable rate. Staff was very pleasant and helpfull. Will stay there again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: HappytrailsOwosso_MI
Reviews.Content: The Yes Hotel in Rome will meet every traveler's needs. This was our first time to Rome and if we return we would stay there again. Outstanding value. Breakfast included. Great location and staff more than helpful. Our room safe had some difficulty opening and the staff responded and fixed it within 5 minutes. Rooms have all gone through new renovation and are very clean and up to date. Mattress a little too firm but that is the only concern we had. Location is great. Close to Termini and easy access to all ground transportation in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, easy location, modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: forevertravel31
Reviews.Content: We just spent 8 nights in Italy and the Yes Hotel was definitely the most modern hotel we stayed in of our five hotels. It was extremely convenient to take our bags just a few blocks from the train station to the hotel by foot. Felt very safe on the walk. You can walk everywhere in Rome but if you want to save time, the metro (junction of the two metro lines) is in the nearby train station so you can get anywhere in no time. This hotel was also very economical compared to hotels near the city center and we got an additional discount for paying in cash. The room was terrific.- very clean and everything seemed brand new. They actually put my husband and I in a triple (double bed and a twin bed) so we had a little extra space for our stuff. We were on the first floor and I was worried about noise from the road and had no problems. Breakfast each morning was included and consisted of the normal bread, pastries, meats/cheeses, cereal, yogurt, juices, coffee, etc- what you see a lot at hotels in Italy. Angelo at the front desk was very helpful and spent a lot of time helping us with recommendations, gave us an hour of free internet and even helped us print out our Vatican tickets on his own computer. Would definitely recommend this hotel, especially if you're looking for a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great "no frills" hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: MissPuffK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and were very pleased with the service and rooms, especially considering the bargain price we paid (about $200AUD per night). This hotel is literally a 3 minute walk from Termini station, but on the northern (less dodgy) side. Rome is pretty to easy to walk around but it is great being near the station if you prefer to catch the train. The location is more about convenience than charm though, so if you're looking for a hotel nestled in amongst great restaurants and bats, this is not for you. It has a 24 desk with helpful staff who speak English well. Our room was lovely, clean and modern. Good tv with plenty of English channels (quite rare in Italy). Free air-conditioning, but you need to ensure ALL windows are closed for it work... we learnt this the hard way. The windows have amazing seals on them to block out sound from the outside. Wi Fi is available in the room for about $6 per day, and there is a PC in the reception area if you don't have a lap-top. The breakfast room is lovely and the buffet breakfast was good. They offer lovely pastries, toast, cereals & fruit. Overall a very pleasant experience and a really nice room for the price-range. You would be hard-pushed to get better value for money in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Yes Hotel - Great Find in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: ukbyron
Reviews.Content: Having booked a cruise from Civitavecchia we decided to have a few days sightseeing in Rome. We found the hotel based on comments from this site and were not disappointed. The hotel is located an easy walking distance from the railway station even with a couple of cases. However, a word of warning - if you arrive by rail from Civitavecchia or Fiumicino Airport you will most likely exit the station on to Via Giovanni Giolitti. Here you will find very helpful taxi drivers telling you your hotel is 3 km away. They will charge anything from 25 euros to over 100 Euros depending on your nationality for a drive around the station to the hotel. As the platforms for these destinations are located about 10 mins walk away from the main station, I strongly suggest you stay in the station and head for platforms 1-24. Then head right and cut through the main station - unmistakeable with shops, bars restaurants etc. Cross the main road ahead of you - Via Masarla - as you exit. Head down Via Marghera and take the first left on to Via Magenta towards the hotel. This is no more than a 15 minute walk and will avoid the extortionate cost of a taxi. We were welcomed by Angelo on reception who is a real star. His advice on restaurants bars and ice cream was spot-on and we can't thank him enough for his help. Our hotel room was spotlessly clean, quiet, well maintained with a modern and similarly clean bathroom. The bed was a little firm but as we were totally wiped out from the heat and walking it didn't really matter. The cleaners also did a great job every day. A continental style breakfast with bread, cheese, cold meats, cereals, juices and coffee was provided in the breakfast room each morning. Adjacent is a small bar with very reasonable prices for wines and beer. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and will definitely stay here when we return.

Reviews.Title: “lovely”
Reviews.Author: mummyd8
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 3 nights, hotel very central. lovely standard. ok room small but fine for staying in(less space to mess!) great value for money as so close to termini for terrivision, metro and tour buses. breakfast continental which set us up for the day. would have no problem recommending hotel or indeed returning

Reviews.Title: “Say "No!" to the Yes Hotel”
Reviews.Author: superkb
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Yes hotel and while it wasn't the worst experience, it wasn't pleasant either. Here are few things to keep in mind when considering this hotel: - The hotel is very close to the train station, which is convenient for the day you need to head to the airport, but means there are terrible food options and nothing to do in the neighborhood. Finding breakfast was not easy. - You have to pay for the internet (why is it not free at this point?) - The a/c was very weak and shut off through out the night. We called the front desk and they were no help, so we ended up opening the windows, only to hear people rolling their suitcases down the sidewalk to the train station all night. Click, click, click.... - The room was clean, but quite small and there was an extra single bed in our room. - The front desk service was not great. They took 20 minutes to check us in and there was no one else in line. They also didn't know how to give us access to the (not free) internet, and directed us to a local internet cafe instead.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: JoanneNI
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 4 nights in August. Great value for money and excellent because it was so close to the train station. Booked a double room but were given a triple for the same price. The safe in the room was great and there was a fridge but we never bothered to use this. Breakfast was great although sometimes it was slow in being refilled. Not really the hotels fault, just a little annoying. Air conditioning in the rooms was great although it did not go below 19C but we found this cold enough. There was a HD ready flat screen in the room, although you don't go to rome to watch tv it was a nice plus. Be aware when u go into the room that the lights are turned on using the keycard. You insert this in the wall. They hadnt told us this and I was completely confused but i dont travel alot. On the last day of our trip we asked the hotel to arrange our taxi to the airport which was very useful as some taxi drivers will charge extra. They also held our luggage in a locked room from 10am to 7pm. My only real negative is the bar in the hotel is not really a 24hr bar as stated but there are restaurants and bars close by. Overall this was a fantastic hotel with very helpful staff for a reasonable price. If we go back to rome we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Yes Hotel is fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: BHWarch
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night and toured Rome the following day. Location is great, very near the central train station (an easy walk to the hotel with roller luggage). The hotel was clean, modern, very helpful staff and the breakfast was one of the best we had throughout our entire trip. This hotel fulfilled all of our expectations and more. Very highly recommended! They babysat our luggage the next day (in a secure room) so we could pick it up in the evening for our flight (no extra charge). What more can you ask?

Reviews.Title: “YES is the BEST of Italy!!!”
Reviews.Author: dallasm0m
Reviews.Content: LOVED the YES Hotel in Italy! Great location by the Termini Station! High Tech and energy efficient, clean and cool, great staff, nice breakfast, wonderful rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied stay at Yes Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jotoLondon
Reviews.Content: This was a very last minute decision. A day before our departure we booked our flight to Rome and needed to find a hotel in the city centre. We would stay only over the weekend and wanted something located in the centre and well connected to the airport. We used the recommendation that were available on the air company website and this is how we found Yes hotel. The hotel seemed to be very nice and had a flower-filled roof garden,a fact that convinced us immediately! Anyway we did our best to refrain our excitement until our actual arrival in the hotel, because as you perfectly know, often the websites make the whole thing look a lot more beautiful than it is, and only once you go in the place you can see how it is for real. We have fully enjoyed our stay there! We found the staff extremely welcome and helpful: at check in they gave us loads of useful information so that we could organize our time at best. They recommended us some places to eat where we discovered very tasteful “homemade” Italian dishes and good pizza! The hotel is perfectly connected with the major tourist sites such as the Coliseum and the ancient centre. You can take the metro which is just around the corner, and get to the place of interest in about 10 minutes. You can even walk to the Trevi Fountain and to the Spanish Steps, what was really pleasurable to do since we enjoyed many sunny days. What more can I say?! The value for money is excellent. Décor of the room, buffet breakfast, friendly staff. We will definitely come back at Yes Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marloes79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at yes hotel last month and were very satisfied with the accommodations and service. We booked the hotel on a last minute online deal and stayed for 3 nigths. The brand new room was small but very well appointed and very clean and so was the bathroom. The staff was courteous and friendly and spoke English. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for reasonably priced beautiful and modern accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “YES TO THE "YES HOTEL"!!!”
Reviews.Author: fintona09
Reviews.Content: YES HOTEL REVIEW we stayed in the yes hotel for four nights and it was great!hotel is very central to everthing and only couple minute walk to termini station, bus stop and metro!staff in the hotel were very helpful and the hotel was spotless!!all modern!breakfast was beautiful catering for everyones needs with range of different foods!the rooms in the hotel were lovely and modern and had good air conditioning!!bathrooms and rooms were cleaned every day and clean towels were provided each day!!rooms were equipped with all facilities nesseccary!! ROME REVIEW-----rome itself has a lot of sight seeing if you have an interest in it!lots of nice restuarants in it to and very central to the YES HOTEL!streets were very dirty with a lot of cigarrette buts and rubbish for apartments!!traffic moves very fast so need to be very careful and a lot of scooters flying about!!!alot of places to see in rome!!nightlife in rome is not a big thing!!there is not a lot of pubs..etc to go to!! i enjoyed my stay in rome but defiantely if you are going for a holiday i would reccomend staying for 3-4 days because you will have seen everything!!i would defiantely reccommed the YES HOTEL to people as it was excellent and very reasonable for the brillant service they provide!!

Reviews.Title: “Simple hotel to meet your traveling needs!”
Reviews.Author: LilPiggyQT
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed about a week at the Yes Hotel (July 18th-July 24th) and we enjoyed our stay very much! Before booking we had checked hotel reviews on TripAdvisor and were impressed with the recommendations. We were not disappointed as we pulled our luggage in through the sliding glass doors. The area around the hotel doesn't look safe (especially at night) but me and my two friends (we are all younger females) walked up and down the streets late in the evening after dinner many times with no issues whatsoever. The Yes Hotel is about one/two blocks to the left of the front entrance of the Termini station (where all of the buses converge at) so it was an extremely convenient location for travelers that need and want to use the Termini station as their base area. The hotel room itself is smaller than what you may be accustomed to but for us the big items that made the room great were that it had air conditioning (though we couldn't make it any warmer than 21 degrees Celcius so we would turn it off after awhile since it would get chilly in the room but it didn't matter since there WAS an air conditioner), a safe to lock your valuables up, complimentary breakfast in the morning (sliced meats and cheeses, pastries, cereal, caffe, juices, yogurt - not a hot breakfast but definitely a good one especially when you wake up hungry and want to save money), daily maid service, a proper bathroom with a hair dryer, and the circuit breaker box in your hotel room (my friend popped a circuit plugging in her hair dryer and it was easily fixed since the box was in the room). The hotel has a contemporary modern design that was very pleasing and all public areas were very clean and well maintained. The price to use the internet service was a very affordable (pay the 10 euro fee!) and it was very handy that the hotel has wi-fi. We met multiple staff members on our stay there and they were all very pleasant. You hand them your room key as you leave and they hand it back to you as you come back to the hotel which I think was a great idea since you didn't have to worry about losing the room key or having it stolen as you were meandering around Rome. Also you plug in your room key into the room key slot when you enter the room to make all of the electronics/lights in the room work as an FYI. The hotel has a breakfast bar/wine bar but there is also a bar nearby that is between the hotel and the Termini station that is packed at night and seems like a good place to drink and mingle and there are a few restaurants in the nearby vicinity. The Termini station also has a few shops and food establishments if the need to shop hits you. The only things we found not desireable about the hotel were the air conditioning issue (they just need to make sure you can make the temperature in the room go higher than 21 degress Celcius) and the fan in the bathroom needs to turn off a little faster when the lights come off (it turns on when you turn on the bathroom light but not the mirror light so if you want just light in the room for a little without the bathroom fan turning on, use the mirror light instead). Those were small issues and they did not deter from our amazing stay at this hotel in Rome. I will definitely book here again when I come back to Rome (I did throw a coin into the Trevi fountain so I should be coming back!) and it made my first visit to this country a lot less stressful since it was an amazing price for our own room and I didn't hate coming back at night to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “We do not recommend this hotel !!!!”
Reviews.Author: jayjay020
Reviews.Content: In the breakfast room there are two ladies who speak Arabic or Russian and mock customers continuously, especially the one with the red nail polish to the toes. Sometimes they bow and use a fictional smiles of courtesy, and it seems that they jeer always at you. the room should also be good if it were not for the constant noise of the fan in the bathroom that have been going on all night. then the a.c. although we try to keep it on, every time we found in off (to save money???). During our stay we saw change many people of the staff (4 or 5) and we didn't talk with the same. The only people we have found available to solve our problems were a boy with dark eyes and stephan (we expected the night to ask him about any problems we had). we asked to speak with the owner, lorenzio. We didn't see him and when the guy at the reception has called him on the phone, we clearly understand that he doesn't want to solve the problem. We were very unhappy about our stay there. We toured many part of Italy, but never we were so bad as in this hotel (such as the breakfast with the leftovers of the day before). They ask the prepayment of the entire stay at check in, and then they don't care about nothing else. If you go to Rome, choose another hotel and stay away from Yes hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Room and bed too small, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: TexasTenor
Reviews.Content: Being close to the Termini was a big positive. But I should never have asked for a French bed. The room was small as to be claustrophobic. It was clean but I did see one cockroach. We did not spend much time in the room. Compared to our hotel in Florence, the Yes was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “A Big Yes”
Reviews.Author: Jaytara
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights in mid-June, choice based on Tripadvisor reviews. We were completely satisfied. Excellent location ( frankly,we did not feel unsafe at all in the area although admittedly we returned to the hotel before 11pm both nights), 5 min walk from Termini rail/metro-hub with plenty of transport options. Room was small but the furnishings were simple but tasteful. Breakfast included cereals, toast, other bread, plus a platter of hams and cheeses. Reception staff, particularly Jonadab, always friendly and helpful.Couple of inexpensive internet cafes on Via Vicenza, the street linking the hotel to Termini.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay Pre Cruise”
Reviews.Author: tlw12
Reviews.Content: Arrived about 1000PM from LAX flight. Checked in no problems. Hotel is very clean and nice. Our room was small but had one of the best showers on our trip. Great water pressure and heat control. The area the hotel is in has quite a bit of grafitti around it. This kind of made my wife and I feel uneasy when we ventured out for dinner at 1030PM. The streets are well lit and the person at registration said it was a safe area. After walking around for 15 minutes and finding a nice place to eat my wife and I felt much more comfortable. The beds felt fine to us. Everyone talks about the hard beds in europe. We have a high quality mattress at home and the hotel mattress was almost the same feel. Linnens were of high quality also and the room was spotless. One of the cleanest rooms that I have seen in all of my travels. The highlight to the 1 day stay was the morning breakfast. We enjoyed some of the best cold cuts and cheese that we had in our 2 weeks in Italy and France. The two beautiful women that were taking care of the breakfast area were very proud of the product they served and it showed. The cold cuts and cheese are cut in the kitchen right next to the serving area and are as fresh as can be. They were GREAT! The coffee was good and strong like we expected they even had an automatic espresso machine that you woked yourself. The rolls and yogert , toppings and the cereal,OJ and fresh milk were all great. The eating area like the rest of the hotel was spotless. This hotel woked great for us and exceeded our expections after reading reviews on TA. We took a tour of Rome the next morning which ended at our cruise port. On the tour we found out that it was not only the area by the Yes hotel that had grafitti which was light compared to the rest of the city. Rome is full of it and it made us sick to see 2200 year old objects sprayed with grafitti. Be prepared to see a sight worst than downtown LA. Don't dwell on it just look through it and see all of the beauty there is to be seen in this wonderful city. Tom and Mary Las Vegas Nevada

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with everything you need”
Reviews.Author: lipaustralia
Reviews.Content: Price paid per night: 85 euros Would I stay again for the price? Yes Would I recommend it for the price? Yes The good: - location, if you are arriving and departing Rome by train - staff, very friendly and helpful, especially Raoul (sp?) at check in - new air con which is very effective - strong shower is nice sized bathroom - comfortable bed - nice breakfast - good security The bad: - nothing We arrived on a Sunday night and went to the hotel based on location near the train station and Trip Advisor recommendations. We haggled for price and got a room for 85 euros for 2 nights, prepaid. Unfortunately they had nothing for our last 2 nights and this is the risk with not pre-booking (but then you pay more). The hotel renovation 2 years ago was clearly excellent and everything is new, modern, clean and works well. The bed and air conditioning (it was over 30 degrees of heat each day we were there) were particularly nice. The breakfast is quite good and served in a comfortable area. They have a computer for guest use in the lobby but its much more expensive than the internet points around the corner (which have no air con however).

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: RJC83
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in May and were very happy with the hotel. Staff are friendly and efficient, especially Raul and Rhodora. Our room 605 with street-facing window in annexe (triple room) was very clean and comfortable, if a little small for 3 adults, but we managed. Our fridge wasn't working at first but was fixed the next day. The breakfast was very good with plenty to choose from. The hotel was very close to the station and we walked just about everywhere or caught Metro for day at the Vatican. The only problems we had were a leaky (very small) shower and an air conditioner which turned itself on randomly through the night to the lowest setting so I woke up freezing - couldn't seem to get that sorted out for the 5 nights. Would highly recommend Yes Hotel to anyone wanting to be close to the station.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Randomnova
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Yes Hotel for four nights in our first trip to Rome. We picked this hotel due to its consistently high rating on Tripadvisor and in general we were not disappointed. The hotel is only a few minutes walk from Termini station and very easy to find (I had located it using Google Streeview in advance). The reception staff were very friendly and helpful and spoke good English. The room was small, but adequate. Bed was large and comfortable. There was a new flat screen TV including some English language news channels (BBC News 24 and CNN). There was a fridge, which was useful for cooling bottles of water (the temperature was 32 degrees celcius outside). The room included a modern quiet air conditiion unit that was so efficient that I got quite cold on the first night and had to swtich it off! Breakfast was adequate. Consisting of croissants (iced!), bread/toast, cold meats, cheeses, cerials, fresh fruit and yogurt. The coffee was undrinkable, but tea was OK. Being close to Termini station, access to all the main sites was easy. We purchased a three day "Roma pass", which includes unrestricted travel on the metro and buses and free admission to two state-run museums or other attraction (such as the Collesium). As the hotel has no resturant it is necessary to eat out, but there are numerous good resturants. I would recommend the La Famiglia on the Via Gaeta, which is only a few minutes walk (we went here twice).

Reviews.Title: “A BIG YES for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cocidius
Reviews.Content: I spent a few days in Rome recently. I had decided to stay near the Termini railway station as I had an early flight and the coach to the Airport departed from the station. There are many medium priced hotels in the area and my eventual choice for this hotel was influenced by Trip Advisor reviews. Hotel Yes is only 5 minutes walk from the station. I received a friendly and informative welcome at Reception and was shown to my room in a very modern and well-decorated annexe. I had a single room with a door to the rear courtyard. The modern room was small but well furnished. The en-suite shower room was spacious. Both were spotless. Breakfast was included in the price and consisted of various cereals, yoghurt, cold meats, cheese, rolls, bread and cakes, two fruit juices, an excellent choice of teas and good Italian coffee. The staff was very efficient and friendly. My visit to Rome was enhanced by my stay at Hotel Yes, especially by Marcello at Reception. I shall return to Rome and definitely to this hotel. I recommend it strongly!

Reviews.Title: “amazing great”
Reviews.Author: hello1112
Reviews.Content: it was perfect stayed for holiday in summer in rome even though outside was hot the rooms where airconditioned

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel near Termini”
Reviews.Author: fmune
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for two nights during the weekend. Many Europeans, what indicates that it does have a good reputation. Rooms are very modern although somewhat small, typical in Europe. Wall are paper thin: you can hear everything that's going on at the corridor. Shower is good but if there is one thing I hate about these hotels is the little tiny soap available. Breakfast is included in all stays I was told. No hot options, but cold cuts, juice machine, coffee machine, pastry and cereal. There is a frigobar that can be used to store beverage. It didn't seem to work in my case, though. There is a good supermarket one block to north so you can stock up with beverage, cheese or the likes. Wireless Internet available throughout the property. They just decreased the price. One day now costs 5 Euro or 10 Euro for the whole stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good option for modern, inexpensive hotel near the train”
Reviews.Author: ETG8R
Reviews.Content: Yes Hotel gave us everything we were looking for...an updated hotel that was well priced and very close to the Termini train station. The rooms are well decorated (after a recent renovation), though ours was very small. The shower was the best we had in Italy, so that was a major plus. We didn't eat breakfast as our flight left too early. If you are flying out of Rome and want a clean, modern hotel near the train station, this is a great option. We walked to all the sights (Coliseum, Trevi, Pantheon, etc) as the location provides easy access.

Reviews.Title: “Very chic and modern in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: AirlineFreak
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were in Rome only 6 months ago, but we loved it so much that we decided to return in spring-time. We had planned on staying at the same hotel as we did last, but instead found this hotel around the corner from the other one through the same website. The location was perfect, but we obviously knew it would be. It is a nice and convenient area with virtually everything within walking distance. The hotel itself was amazing. The rooms and the common spaces (lobby, corridors etc.) look brand new and are extremely stylish. Although the rooms aren't the largest, you can hardly expect that in a popular city like Rome, especially not at these rates. Not that it's a particularly cheap hotel. On the contrary, you pay a premium for the boutique atmosphere, but not nearly as much as most other hotels in this category. We don't usually stay in this type of fancy hotels, but at this cost, we could afford it and it was well worth it. Just the feeling of pampering yourself was exactly what you needed for a few days' holiday off work. The staff were great as well. Even though we had been to Rome before, we had only been for a short stay and still appreciated the staff's help. I don't know if it is that the staff were so enthusiastic about the hotel themselves that did it, but they were all extremely warm and helpful throughout our three-night stay. Breakfast was also good. I see some other reviews note the lack of hot breakfast options, but that is not part of our usual breakfast routine, so it was not missed by us. If anything, we were just grateful we didn't get the sweet and unfilling Italian style breakfast we have been served elsewhere in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Teti_9
Reviews.Content: My stay at the YES Hotel was amazing. From the moment I entered the hotel, I was treated in a very professional and kind manner. I must say that the hotel is somewhat hard to find, but if you print a map from the hotel's website you should be fine. Coming from a hospitality background I am rather picky about the hotels I stay in; however, I must say this hotel in particular, definitely exceeded my expectations. The only issues that I had was the sound the front door made every time it was opened and closed and the variety of cold cuts for breakfast was not the greatest ( I mean there were none and no one bothered to re-fill the tray). Other than that, it's a great cheap chic hotel that provides great service for your money. Definitely will book again!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy room, small space, but great location”
Reviews.Author: NhuToronto
Reviews.Content: Our room was next to the elevator and the walls were very thin - difficult to fall asleep if you are a light sleeper. Ear plugs advised. Nice clean room but very crampy. 2 minutes away from the main train/metro station - very convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Good central hotel”
Reviews.Author: intsik
Reviews.Content: Yes Hotel is a solid hotel for Rome. It is located around five minutes walk from the Termini station, where the trains, the buses and the subway meet. The area itself is not the best in Rome, but it makes everything else very accessible. The room is on the smaller size, though by no means tiny. The bathroom is sufficient enough. Clean and pretty basic, but nothing to complain about. They serve a cold breakfast. It could be better by adding more variety, and a even a couple of hot items. Service is very good though. The front desk is extremely helpful with any questions and recommendations you may require.

Reviews.Title: “YES! We'll stay there again and again”
Reviews.Author: MarcMarco
Reviews.Content: Great hotel close to Termini Train Station, Subway and walking distance from major touristic places. We stay there for three days in April 09, location is great, rooms are spacious, clean, and new. Breakfast was simple but great with plenty of selection. The reception with Giuseppe provide infinte information and reliable suggestion. You can usw the internet cafe around the corner. Two tumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic city”
Reviews.Author: BluebirdFACup08
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 day break in this wonderful city. Booked hotel and flight package through Easijet, with some trepidaton I must admit having seen horrifying tales about the company on tv. I shouldn't have worried! The booking process on line was straightforward and very clear about their policies and requirements. Easy check in procedures, polite staff. We decided not to lug our 2 cases on the metro to get from Ciampino airport as a brochure I picked up in the arrivals area said that a taxi would cost 30 euros, a standard fare. Taxi rank immediately outside the arrivals area and plenty of taxis available. Polite driver took our cases and led us to his taxi, then our problems began.... We first of all showed him the brochure stating the 30 euro fee but he insisted that because we had 2 cases the cost would be 35 euros. We argued this as advised in my tourist guide book, but he became angry and insulting, and at one point I thought he was going to stop the taxi and make us get out. We finally agreed to pay 35 euros but told him to forget a tip! He had his revenge, however, cos he dropped us off a street away from our hotel, which is not well signed. Look for a street sign showing Hotel New York, opposite the Hotel Milani, and you'll find the Yes hotel. Fluent english speaking male receptionist showed us to our small but immaculate room in an annex 2 doors down the street. No charge for the safe deposit box in room very limited storage space for our clothes. Room cleaned and fresh towels daily. Only problem I encountered was when I asked for 2 extra pillows, was told they would be in our room later that day, then told they didn't have any. I confess I made a fuss, to my husbands dismay, but 2 pillows were miraculously produced, apparently borrowed from another hotel! Breakfast was served between 7 and 10 and consisted of selection of cold meats, cheese, cereal and the rest of the usual stuff and was sufficient to start the day. Reception booked a taxi for the return trip and the driver this time confirmed the 30 euro charge. All sights within walking distance, but would not recommend this city for anyone with disability. Cobbled streets and loads of steps.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Price and Modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Buddy2009Tokyo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is modern and well designed with excellent staff and very helpful. They speak excellent English and will happily arrange anything for you. Situated a few blocks from the main train station it is handily located for sightseeing with buses, the Metro and mainline trains all on your doorstep. Had some issue with A/c but later found that this is a rule in Italy. I will recommend this hotel to my friends. I was quite satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: nyc774
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for the price. You get a very clean, modern room (although very small) in a central location. You can walk to Roma Termini, the main train station in Rome. Here you can catch the metro or the rail to other parts of Italy. It is a little suspect at night but since it's such a short walk to the hotel from the train station, it really didn't bother us. From the airport, the ride is about 30 minutes and costs about 15 euros per person. The breakfast was continental, croissants, cereal, yogurt, typcial Italian fare The staff was very friendly and always helpful. The only thing that bothered me was that there was no iron in the rooms, you had to iron your clothes in this closet downstairs! But overall, this is a great hotel for your money. I would recommend it to anyone travelling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in an overrated city.”
Reviews.Author: stanley9
Reviews.Content: This hotel is modern and well designed with excellent staff who cannot do enough to help you. They speak excellent English and will happily arrange anything for you. Situated a few blocks from the main train station it is handily located for sightseeing with buses, the Metro and mainline trains all on your doorstep. The only negative about the location is that the area around the station is slightly suspect, particularly late at night. Also, there is a distinct lack of decent eating places locally. Having said that, we found that most restaurants in Rome were hideously overpriced and mediocre at best. Incidentally, we did a day trip to Florence by train and found that it was far superior to Rome in all areas. The rooms in the hotel are fairly compact but extremely clean and well set out. The breakfast of a morning is a cold buffet affair put perfectly reasonable. Be aware though that there isn't much soundproofing and the hotel is quite noisy of a nightime. If you are a light sleeper, the chances are you will be awoken by other guests returning late at night. Finally, don't bother going on any organised trips. Rome is totally overpriced and you can do most things cheaper yourself. Even the Roma Pass isn't that much of a bargain when you consider you can get a day ticket for all the buses and Metro for just 4 Euros. Out of all the places we visited, our favourite was the Catacombs.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, great price”
Reviews.Author: S_MARIE22
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at Yes Hotel for three nights at the end of a 7 day tour of Florence and Rome. We originally booked Hotel Felice and became increasingly nervous about the hotel. We decided to cancel our reservation and booked Yes based upon the reviews on this site. We were so thankful that we did! The staff was very helpful and the complimentary breakfast was a nice touch. Nothing more than the usual fare, but enjoyable. The rooms were fairly small, but we didn't spend much time in the room....there was too much to see and do! The hotel was also in a great location (2 blocks from Termini) for us given that we commuted via the metro or buses during the day. We visited Pompeii from Rome and the proximity to the train station was yet again helpful. We also found a nice little place nearby, Taverna Pretoriana, and went there for a late dinner. The food was very good and the waiters were so much fun!

Reviews.Title: “Go For it!”
Reviews.Author: vacaay2009
Reviews.Content: My friend and I picked Yes Hotel for our stay in Rome, after reading the many positive review on tripadviosr, and we were not disappointed!!! The location, staff, rooms, were great! It is a little bit hard to find, if you don't look for the Hotel New York sign next door, but it is a very clean and safe hotel. The receptionist was very helpful with maps and giving pointers on how to get to places and where to eat. I would stay here again, if Im ever in Rome again!

Reviews.Title: “Yes to Yes hotel”
Reviews.Author: elsalawy
Reviews.Content: A gem in the middle of Rome attractions, with superb location, being close to Train station, walking distance to ground transportaion, and attractions. Very nice, English speaking staff. Very modern hotel. Breakfast is an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Poolma
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 day visit to Rome. If you are looking to stay near the Termini I would recommend this great littl hotel. The bst thing about it is the location. It is only 2 blocks from the Termini on a quiet side street. We saved big on transportation costs by taking the Express train from Fiumicno Airport to Termini then walking to the hotel. The Metro and all the buses were also right there so we saved big on taxis. Also there is a great grocery store called Conrad right by the entrance to Termini off via Marsala. The hotel rooms are very small and basic but it is only 2 years old so the furnishings are new and modern. There is a small fridge and safe in the room. The hotel is very clean and the maids do a great job. The continental breakfast that is included is okay and will keep you going until lunch. The staff was very helpful with directions and recommendations. I got a discounted rate of 265 Euros for 3 nights which works out to around $100/night which is pretty decent. It's a great place to stay for the location and the price.

Reviews.Title: “Can't recommend this hotel enough!”
Reviews.Author: lou_139
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved everything about this hotel. My sister and I stayed in the hotel for 2 nights and everything, including price, was excellent. The staff were so helpful and recommended lots of really good restaurants for us to eat in. They were brilliant value, very friendly and the food was delicious. Even if you have a large budget, I really don't think that you can beat this hotel on anything.

Reviews.Title: “The place to say in ROME!!”
Reviews.Author: njwaite
Reviews.Content: What an excellent hotel and very good value for money! It was situated near to the metro line and this made it easy for us to travel around Rome.
