The reception staff were amazing recommending restaurants, places to visit, routes to take etc. Breakfast was simple but delicious and always fresh. The rooms were very clean and were cleaned daily. If you are going on holiday to Rome - stay HERE!! You won't regret it!!

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up to Yes Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca064
Reviews.Content: We've just got back from an absolutely fabulous long weekend in Rome and can honestly say that we certainly made the right hotel choice. From the moment we walked into the lobby I knew it was going to be an enjoyable stay, the girl at the reception desk was fantastic, very attentative and keen to make us feel welcome and at home, as were the rest of the staff over the 3 days we were with them. They loaded us with maps and information that really helped us tackle the city and we found their suggestions and restaurant recommendations to be useful and spot on! I absolutely loved the decor, it felt so trendy and new (just what we were looking for). The whole atmosphere was to our liking and we will definately be recommending this cosy hotel to our friends.... all I can say is don't forget to try the croissants at breakfast and as for the price BARGAIN BARGIAN BARGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JRHowarth
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel in a great location to see Rome. Nice and helpful front desk staff who can tell you of plenty of places to eat near to the hotel. Only a 2mins walk from the Terminee train station as well. Would stay here again, no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Eusmery
Reviews.Content: Nice room, very clean, confortable and good price, close to train station

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Yes Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelor2008
Reviews.Content: Great value for money. Accomodation was clean, bright, and modern. Had everything to make the stay comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “very central”
Reviews.Author: romelover12
Reviews.Content: a well situated hotel close to the termini station, handy for the metro, local buses and the coach back to the airport. a small bar is good value, and the breakfast was good quality. reception staff friendly and very helpfull with local places to see. room was very clean and had a fridge for your drinks. towels changed daily, with plenty of soap and sampoo. i would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: puxadoraz
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Yes Hotel and we were impressed by the hotel from the moment we stepped through the doors! It was a modern little place with the most wonderful staff, Giuseppe who greeted us with such warmth and profesionalism. That night, as we used our laptop in the lounge, he even offered us cups of tea because he was making one for himself! The room was fine, modern, two single beds placed together to form a 'double' bed but not uncomfortable. The internet connection was bad in the room and can only be used in the lounge. Breakfast was ok, not bad but not GREAT. The lady at the breakfast area was very nice, we spilled some milk and she graciously waved our offers to help with the mess and got on all fours and cleared the mess immediately. The wonderful staff made the good hotel GREAT! The area the hotel is located in is good, very near Termini Station, which not only houses the metro, train but also a shopping center. BUT, as usual, there are seedy characters and foreigners around that area.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for the price”
Reviews.Author: theeb
Reviews.Content: We stayed there on May 2008 on sight seeing Rome, this is walkable from Termini, room size is adequate, clean, good breakfast, smiling and helpful frontdesk staff. Overall, one can have a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for family stay”
Reviews.Author: shridaran
Reviews.Content: I was with my family in this hotel. It is near to the rome railway station, easy to access and when we arrived it was around 12.15 mid night . We booked thro' the hotel website. The Front office guy was looking brisk and was smiling. The room was good, spacious and kept clean. The breakfast was nice. we stayed for 2 nights and stay was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Anastasia”
Reviews.Author: Belo4ka
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not bad - and good for the price. They also make discounts if you pay cash (but be ready to pay in advance - at acheck in). The room is small but clean and good equipped - even with a fridge. The location of the hotel is good - not far from the Station, but on the neighbouring is quite safe. Still during my stay there were some problems. It was very noisy in the room - there was no isolation from the corridor. I had to use the reserve lift and steps due to renovation - it was inconvenient. You have to go out into the street - and then enter the hotel to have your breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “City Break”
Reviews.Author: dafthat
Reviews.Content: We always intended to see Rome with friends but where could we stay? The Yes Hotel is a good choice for location. From the airport there is good public transport to the Termini it takes 20 mins. and costs 7 Euros return. The Yes is only a 2 minute walk away from the Termini. The hotel is clean and modern, the staff are very helpfull and polite. Breakfast is bread, ham, cheese, cereal etc. The bar is basic so eat and drink out. Can recomend this hotel if you need a base to stay and is very close to Metro links and bus routs. Get a transport ticket for 3 days you can go on any bus or Metro for 12 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Librarian66
Reviews.Content: Yes Hotel, is spotlessly clean, the staff are extremely helpful and treat every question with equal importance. They are cheerful and friendly, the breakfast was fine, a small improvement could be some fresh fruit and tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms. The location is good, we were a little concerned after reading some reviews about the area around Termini but we did not feel threatened or uncomfortable at any time, in fact even though it was an unattractive area it had a nice atmosphere. Would definitely use Yes hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of love for the Yes Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lonimuse
Reviews.Content: Amazing location. Excellent decor. Good breakfast. Clean. Cool. Friendly staff. Would stay again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Yes Hotel: Maybe”
Reviews.Author: KittyChan
Reviews.Content: For my first trip to Rome in nearly 20 years, I selected Yes Hotel, in part based its high TA ranking and positive reviews. After a weekend stay in late October 2008, would I choose Yes again for a future Roman holiday? Maybe, but probably not. Here's why. Pros: (1) Location (also see Cons): Yes is just a few minutes' walk from Rome's Termini Station, which means that you can get from Fiumicino Airport via the Leonardo Express train to the hotel in under an hour. As with many big Euro cities, the area around Rome's major train station is not great -- but it is safe and replete with cheap eats from around the world (although I can't imagine why anyone would want to eat anything other than local cuisine in one of the world's greatest food cities). Many of Rome's attractions are withing walking distance (mostly long walks, I must add) or short taxi or metro rides from the Yes. (2) Ambience and decor: Yes looks good, from the small but smart lobby to the modern, attractive rooms. I stayed in a double, which wasn't large but larger than your average Euro three-star room. The bathroom was quite large, with a full bath and "watering-can"-style rain shower. My room had a newish, wall-mounted flat-screen TV and decent A/C. (While Rome wasn't hot in late October, temps did reach nearly 70C/21F during the day, and the room was a bit stuffy.) The decor was quite nice: dark wood, rich contrasting fabrics. Cons: (1) Front-desk policies: Perhaps this is normal for mid-range hotels in Rome, but I was surprised when the evening front-desk clerk who checked me in asked me to pay for my stay in full in advance. I'd used a website other than Yes's to book my stay, and he said that had I used the hotel's website, I would have received an e-mail confirmation of reservation clearly stating the advance-payment requirement. Still. I put the amount on my credit card, only to receive another surpise: a demand (well, request, but it didn't seem to be wavable) to leave a deposit against the (electronic) room key. I left 5 Euros. Breakfast was included in my rate (135 Euros/night) but the available wifi internet was not, so I shelled out another 10 Euros for 24 hours of that. (2) Location/street noise: The downside of Yes's convenient location was the attendant street noise from people and cars in the very busy area around the hotel. It wasn't bad late at night, but I don't recommend the hotel for light sleepers. Yes is located in two adjacent but not adjoining buildings; the main building has just two floors, and the annex -- in which I stayed -- has rooms just on the ground floor. Again, the room was comfortable, and the large windows -- pretty, but with nothing to see from them -- were pretty well insulated. (3) Breakfast: I wouldn't pay extra for Yes's breakfast, which was basic: rolls, a few cold cuts, cheese, watery yoghurt, food-service coffee from an urn, and dry cereals. Not inspiring by any means, but with good food and arguably the world's best coffee available on every block, no one needs a hotel breakfast in Rome. (4) Beds: I know this is a common Euro-hotel trick (especially in the two- and three-star range), but I was disappointed to see that my "double" bed was actually two narrow twins covered with a double sheet. I felt the crack between the two beds, and while it wasn't a sleep wrecker (the bed was fairly firm and comfortable overall), I wouldn't take such a "double" bed again. Upshot: I give the three-star Yes 3 out of 5. I'd consider staying again, but only for 100 Euros or less. Rome appears to have many good (better?) three- and four-star hotels in or near that price point, so Yes is definitely a maybe for Roman-holiday lodging.

Reviews.Title: “Three x Yes!”
Reviews.Author: ukwlb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Yes Hotel with two girlfriends whilst on a site-seeing trip to Rome. Excellent location for the Termini Train Station and Bus Station, and therefore all the sites, tourist bus stops etc. The hotel was clean, modern and felt safe and secure. We had a very comfortable triple room. Breakfast included was good and plentiful. The hotel staff were friendly, knowledgeable and very helpful. Special mentions should go to Marcello and Raul on reception who gave us restaurant recommendations and made countless phone calls for us to another hotel to locate friends. If I go to Rome again I would definitely stay here. On my last trip to Rome I stayed in a pit. I won't name it here, but the Yes Hotel was a really pleasant surprise. My two girlfriends loved it too, so three thumbs up and three x yes for the Yes!!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: darkaMontreal
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel perfectly located in Downtown Rome. A two minute walk to the main train station. Modern, clean and beautifully designed rooms at a great price. Buffet breakfast included fresh home made yogourt and a wide selection of food. Friendly staff were very helpful with maps and providing us with a place that offers free internet. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff good location for restaurants & transport!!”
Reviews.Author: c1airebear
Reviews.Content: I was a bit dubious about this hotel after finding some negative reviews however, after staying there (4 nights) we could not find fault with this hotel. The staff were extremely friendly, courteous and did everything they could to help us (particulary Marcelo) - we have a 5 month old baby - re. cot, heating baby milk - they even upgraded us to a superior room at no extra cost to accommodate the cot they supplied us. The superior room was adequate in size & so I would imagine the standard doubles are quite small, in keeping with most hotel rooms in Rome. The rooms are very clean & the hotel is nice & modern however a critisicm I would have is that the beds are a little hard. I forgot to take pictures of the hotel to put on here, however the photos on the Yeshotelrome.com website are a good representation of the hotel - often the pictures aren't and can be misleading. This is not the case for this hotel. There isn't a restaurant (just a breakfast room) which didn't pose a problem for us as we like to get out of the hotel each evening but there are plenty of restaurants around. I would recommend the trattorias as they are family run - tend to be better value, much friendlier and great food. Look on the Yeshotelrome.com website as it has a list of local restaurants you can get a 10% discount from when staying at Yes hotel. There is also a supermarket 2 min walk, and the termini station is also about 5 mins walk. I would recommend this hotel, and would have absolutely no hesitation in staying at this hotel again, it was lovely. I would also recommend buying the tourbus tickets (yellow buses are religious tours, green are parks and red is basically everything). We took the red bus, you can hop on and off as many times as you want in 24 hours - they are excellent value and a great way of seeing everything without walking everywhere and spending a fortune in taxi fares. if you do catch a taxi, always ask them to put the meter on - they have a habit of charging a little bit extra if they think you don't know the area (which we do).

Reviews.Title: “yes sweet”
Reviews.Author: tbacheller
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice. It was a bit small, but it was for only one person. The staff are very friendly and helpful. I asked them for a wake up call since there are no alarm clocks in the rooms. The breakfast was good, and the hotel overall was clean. The location is great, right by Termini station and within walking distance to lots of sights. There are two good internet cafes nearby on Via Panisperna. I also saw a Mac in the lobby, so you might be able to surf the net on that, but I didn't get around to checking it out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experiance at the YES Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: romeseptember2008
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Rome and if you stay at this hotel you will not be disappointed. The hotel is exactly as it appears on the web site! Our room [triple bedroom] was excellently proportioned. The room was air conditioned, modern and very clean. The staff on the reception desk was very helpful, advising where to go to see the main sights including bus routes/numbers. We were given a map showing directions, which was useful during our stay. The hotel is central and close to the train and bus termini, surrounded by some lovely restaurants and bars. Breakfast is served 7am-10am each day and consists of Coffee/Tea/ Fruit juices, cereals, bread rolls and croissants. Which we found to be adequate during our stay. I can honestly say that you will enjoy your stay in Rome if you visit the YES hotel. Mrs Johnstone England

Reviews.Title: “Modern and clean”
Reviews.Author: nessthetraveler
Reviews.Content: This was a very clean and modern hotel. Breakfast was included in the price. They were running a special so we got the deal cheaper than staying in a monastary! I would highly recommend this hotel for your stay in Rome. It is right by the termini train station so it was very local to all locations. The area around doesn't look too good, but the hotel itself was extremely safe and nice. I was very surprised! There was air condition too! They let you store your luggage if you check out and have a later flight. The staff is EXTREMELY helpful!

Reviews.Title: “A Definite Yes”
Reviews.Author: cindyh1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently had the immense pleasure of staying at the Yes hotel in Rome. Located one block from the main train and bus terminal it is the perfect location for exploring and staying in Rome. It is a modern hotel set in a quiet neighbourhood only a 20 minute walk from the colosseum. The staff are friendly, speak fluent English and go out of their way to be of service to all patrons staying at the hotel. From giving directions to all of Rome's attractions, assisting in booking tours, giving shopping advice, booking restaurant reservations, and sending us to the best gelato store in Rome, all is done with the utmost effort, friendliness and enthusiasm. We never once felt like we were intruding on the staff's day. The breakfast is outstanding with everything one would need to start the day off right; cheeses, cold meats, yogurt, fruit, croissants, cereals, juices, coffee and tea. The staff were available at all hours to assist in any way necessary. I cannot say enough about this lovely, personal hotel and would not stay anywhere else on our return trip to Rome. The "Yes" hotel is a definite Yes for any visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Yes for the Yes hotel!”
Reviews.Author: IngeandMarion
Reviews.Content: The Yes hotel is just a fantastic hotel. It's near by the Termini station, so on a very good location. The hotel was very clean; we've never had such a clean hotel before! We almost thought my grandmother was the cleaner... Our room was excellent; clean, average size, and a grand bathroom. The beds were quite hard, but after one night you won't feel it anymore. We had a airco either and worked very well. There was also a minibar so we always had fresh water. The staff were very friendly and very helpfull. They spook English very well and even called to the attractions in Rome for getting us more information (about opening times, etc...). They even ordered our postcards! The breakfast was small, but decent. Some sandwiches, sweet bread, meat, cheese, cornflakes, yoghurt, fruit... Conclusion: a very nice, little hotel, good location and very clean! And very friendly staff. So say Yes to Yes: you won't be disappointed. We will definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, clean, good location would recommend”
Reviews.Author: tiff21x
Reviews.Content: The only complaint I had of this hotel was the sign outside the hotel.. Its booked as the Yes Hotel, but the sign above it said New York Hotel above the glass door, ( the only way I knew I was at the right place was because of another reviewers comments) I thought overall it was a nice hotel, good location just a few blocks, or 7 minute walk from the Termini(which is great because this is the place the bus drops you off at from the airport) I always felt safe walking back to the hotel at night (it was just me and my 2 bff gfs)... aside from catching the trainsthe Termini itself was like one big galleria mall, with shops, restaurants, and yes McDonalds(they CHARGE u extra 4 ketchup!!! LOL)........... the hotel itself............................................ in walking distance to many internet cafes, restaurants, grocery store, staff was friendly(especially Marcell) we had a triple room which was nice, and clean.. good size bathroom, flat screen tv..breakfast, I would definately stay here again....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: YN_LO
Reviews.Content: The hotel was within walking distance from the Termini station and was easy to locate eventhough we reached quite late. The place is quite new and the room was clean and comfortable with flat screen tv. The breakfast was simple but adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - really enjoyed my stay here”
Reviews.Author: roman_goddess753
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend in May 2008, and was pleasantly surprised seeing as this is only a three star hotel. The room was nicely decorated (art deco-ish theme) and very clean. We had twin beds which were very comfortable, and the bathroom was roomy and also spotless. The breakfast was a standard cereal/fruit/pastry offering, but this was not a big deal as we were just happy to grab something to eat before heading out for the day. The front desk staff were extremely nice and very helpful and were good at recommending places to eat. There are lots of lovely restaurants in the area and although people have said that the area is dodgy, we certainly felt safe enough walking about (we are two young women). I would definitely come back to this hotel as I know I will get a clean, safe, comfortable room in a really convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Yes Hotel gets a YES vote”
Reviews.Author: JaydubAustralia
Reviews.Content: The Yes Hotel in Rome offers modern, sleek accomodation in contrast to the usual antiquities that dominate the city (and much of Italy). Our double room was comfortable, though not spacious, with quality fittings, a safe, aircon, flat screen TV (not used by us but available if needed) and plenty of storage for clothes. The bathroom was also clean and modern with a large shower allowing room to move. Breakfast was very good - cereal, fruit, meat and cheese as well as the usual croissant/bread with coffee. it was served in the area called the "bar" but in the four nights we were there, we were the only people ever in the bar late in the day. It is very small and quite dark so you couldn't sit and read the paper or a magazine while having an afternoon aperitif - but if you want a drink, it is supposedly open 24 hours/day. There is 24hour reception, with locked glass doors at the entry to the hotel providing additional security. Finally, the location of the hotel just a couple of short blocks away from Termini Station makes it very convenient for people arriving in Rome that way (ie express train from the airport). And there are many restaurants in the neighborhood. All round - a Yes vote for the Yes Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: paultry
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Yes Hotel for 1 night in May. The overall experience was average: We were given what must surely be, even by italian standards, The Small Room (no.603). The "double" bed was more like a king-single, even for us folk of average size. The room was on the ground floor and indeed felt very close to the street. Yet it was certainly no cheaper! In contrast, the bathroom was huge - almost the size of the bedroom itself, and very clean. Staff were professional and helpful with excellent english. Breakfast was fine. The location was good too - about 5 mins walk from the train station. The main problem I had was the noise. Bikes seemed to roar past our streetfront window until midnight. An offstreet room might've made me feel less negative about the whole experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Luis M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very modern. The rooms are average size (for Europe) and extremely clean. It is located in a very quiet street just three blocks from the Termini train station, the Metro and most bus lines. Breakfast was very filling. I sincerely recommend this hotel to all who are traveling to Rome. Marcelo, the Argentinian desk clerk made us feel very welcome and was full of helpful information. All staff members spoke English.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad”
Reviews.Author: SamanthaOK
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Yes Hotel from 24/01/08 until 27/01/08, (today). The hotel is in an excellent location but has two different signs on it calling it the 'New York Hotel' and another name , I think it was 'Giancarlo Hotel'. If you look very closely in the glass door, there is a subtley inscribed 'Y' and 'H' and the word 'YES' in very small letters??? The maps that you can buy there or indeed are given to you by tour guides, etc are ALL wrong and ALL different from eachother so it took us a while to find this hotel. It was only by asking at other hotels that we did so look out for this. You have to look for the Via Marsala, which runs directly along the side of the Termini station and the Via Magenta runs parallell with this road. It's about a 2 min walk from Termini; fabulous once you know. Apart from this, the actual hotel is very nice. It's immaculately clean, although the rooms are small. The breakfast room is tiny and I imagine in high season you would have to queue. It must only seat about 24 people maximum. The breakfast was adequate, nothing special but ok; rolls, croissants, jams, ham, cheese, a few cereals, tinned fruit and yoghurt. The coffee was undrinkable so we just drank tea every day. Our room looked out onto the bins and a sort of 'courtyard', if you could call it that. A horrible view so the shutters were kept closed. It was so warm in the room on our first night and we couldn't work out how to turn on the air con, (we never did). We finally opened the window a tiny bit at about 3 in the morning. This is in January and yet an infected mosquito got in and bit my face and hand quite badly!! I had a swollen face and hand for the rest of our stay. So do not open the windows unless you have to. (This is probably obvious but we couldn't sleep in that room without air). The open topped tour buses are good if you only have a few days and they stop on Via Marsala, which is about 2 mins from the hotel and City Sightseeing costs 14 Euros each for 2 days. Always make sure you know when and where they are going to pick you up though as they are very unclear and finish at about 5.30pm, possibly leaving you stranded somewhere. It can be very difficult to find your way back without proper street signs or correct maps. I would recommend this hotel because it was clean and in an excellent location. The staff were friendly enough and the breakfast was included in the price and was adequate. When I return to Rome very soon hopefully, I will stay at Hotel Colosseum, a brilliant hotel, which I thoroughly recommend. It was fully booked for this weeks visit.. The Yes Hotel is good but the Colosseum is much better and about the same price. This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC. * You cannot edit your review after you submit it.

Reviews.Title: “Gem Of A Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lisalee1
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a long weekend with my fiancee in rome, and what a lovely time we had, this hotel is great in every way possible, nice rooms, cleaned every day, lovely helpful staff, nice continental breakfast and what a location 2 minutes from Termini station. I booked my room directly with hotel and the email were replied promptly with loads of information. The receptionists are very friendly and I know this is very important as I hate staying in hotels with miserable receptionists. It was my fiancees birthday and there was a complimentary bottle of wine on ice when we got back in the evening (lovely touch) and we had a problem with our safe (forgetting the number) this was resolved instantly. You will not be dissapointed with this hotel I can assure you - I will definatly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: Clogs43
Reviews.Content: Beware this hotel frequently baits and switches its guests! Make sureBooked this hotel months in advance and had everything confirmed by e-mail. Had read on Trip advisor that the hotel had previously baited people with the new Yes hotel to only switch its visitors to its older sister hotel. Forewarned we thought this would not happen to us. Upon our arrival at the hotel after a long intercontinental flight we were told that there were technical difficulties with our Rome and we would had been rebooked to the sister hotel. This sounded very familiar! We argued our case and told them that we would not accept this as we had read about there practices on Tripadvisor. The receptionist became very defensive and told us that the heating was not working properly and that our room would be too cold. Strangely enough lots of other guests came and went who managed to stay in the "too cold room" while were discussing this all. But what can one do when you arrive dead tired with two young children and lots of luggage in mid December in Rome? Eventually we accepted our fate and accepted our transfer to the sister hotel a few streets down the road. The hotel is nice but much older and appeared to be full of young people, it felt more like a youth hostel! Room was spacious for 4 people and the staff extremely helpful and friendly. This does not take away the fact that we felt ripped of, we were charged the same price as for the Yes hotel and got an old and much more down market hotel instead!

Reviews.Title: “nice stay...great staff”
Reviews.Author: ramblingman77
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, and great price though I do believe they have rasied prices. Newley remodeled hotel. Had flat screen tv, and nicely furnished room. security safe, etc. Size fit into the european standard. The staff was beyond all expectations. Nice area, and close to most. It was actually centralized. Secured hotel. The only issue I had was the tiled hallways. SOunds carried, but traffic was minimal. If you are unceratin about booking at a hotel, this is a sure bet. Trust me, the hotels in Rome pushed the star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and switch”
Reviews.Author: switchSydney
Reviews.Content: It's hard to write a review for the Yes Hotel, given that we booked it but did not get to stay there. Upon arrival, we were informed that there was a "technical problem" with our room. We were then summarily packed off (with no further explanation or alternative offered) to another hotel (the Hotel des Artistes) four blocks away. Whilst we didn't ever get to see the Yes Hotel rooms, the Des Artistes was very much at the lower end of what would be expected from a three-star - and did not resemble the reviews or photos on this website about the Yes Hotel. It is hard to avoid the conclusion that this hotel practices "bait and switch" - hook customers with internet pictures of the the much newer and nicer Yes Hotel, then send them off to a sister property down the road. Our name was already on the Des Artistes guest list when we arrived - suggesting that this outcome was organised in advance between the hotels. This may have been a genuine technical issue (and at least we got a room somewhere) - but if this was really the case, there should have been more explanation and support provided. It seemed that this was simply business as usual for both hotels. Indeed, unlike some other properties, the Yes Hotel adds a paragraph covering this possibility in its up-front terms and conditions - suggesting to me at least that this is a common practice. There was nothing really wrong with the replacement hotel as such (although value for money was marginal at EUR159) - but we simply felt taken for a ride, and for this reason we would not choose to use this hotel group again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location made it all so easy”
Reviews.Author: nellb
Reviews.Content: This Hotel really was just right for us. My husband and I took our 11 year old son to Rome (somewhere our son had wanted to go since learing about the Romans at school). First I must say how easy the hotel is to find. We came off the train from the airport, and then turned right leaving the station via the exit at the end - few minutes walk thru the station in the shade! On leaving the station cross the cobbled road and the Hotel is easy to find a street back and to the left. We really couldnt believe how quick we were in our hotel room on leaving the station. In fact the train from the airport only took half an hour and we brought our tickets from the little shop opposite where you come up from the plane terminal. The man in the shop was very helpfull and we brought our return ticktes then and there as they are only valid once you valildate then in the yellow machine at the end of the platform so buying the return tickets there ment we didnt have to worry about getting them at the termini. The hotel reception gave us our key quickly and a helpfull map. So, happy to be in the room with no major hicups and no kid hissy fits! We were again pleased with the room - just right we had a family room, a double bed not a big gap between that and the single but its all you need and the bathroom worked really well tto again not big but just enought to make it ok. We all said we would like to go back to Rome and if we did we would stay at the Yes Hotel again. Breakfast is nothing special but its not rubbish either - stuff to wet your whistle and get you off on your day out really - a couple of times we sat at a table that hadnt been cleared but the waiter soon came and took the dirty stufff away - the breakfast room is small with not much room to move which could have made the start to the days a mare - watch the two steps if you sit at the end - you will forget they are there and stumble down - every morning we watched the same people do it! Staying here made every where a doddle to get to. 2 mins from the termini so 2 mins from the two tube lines. Still you will walk your feet off and to be honest my feet still have not forgiven me for the pounding I gave them - I read lots about Rome b 4 we left , keen to make the most of the time we would spend there and nothing I read really prepared me for how my feet would feel - I truly am active, being a mum 2 a sport crazy boy - I though my sensible clark walking shoes would stand up to it but they never - please please get the right shoes. Rome. Well, we could not choose a best bit, it was all best! Look up on here the Rome guide and the food guide - we went to the ice cream places and the two that are the oldest are the best and one of them is two blocks the other side of the termini - well worth a detour on your way home - do look it up you wont be sorry it is wellworth it. Pay for what you want at the pay desk then take your ticket to the counter. Our son loved the granite. The other one is on the list as near the Pantheon. When you go to the Colosseum walk past the enternace and go towards the Arc go up the little hill and past the fist kiosk then buy your ticket at the next kiost which is the ticket office for the Roman Forum, when we were there there was no que at all, not a single person (if you are travelling with kids be sure to have acopy of their passport then you will only have to pay half for them if you dont have it they will expect you to pay full price for them) So if you have time do go in this bit it is soo interesting and so old its hard to get it that its still there! If you dont want to go around this bit go back to the Colosseum and take a look at the que - you may not be able to see but go to the left and you will come to a fast lane saying groups go up there and put your ticket in the machine and your in and you dodged the 2 hour que! Like any city it is easy to eat rubbish! We had a 'rubbish' meal the first night neat the Hotel right at the other end of the same street the hotel is in. The best meal we had was two roads back from the hotel in Via Millie - we went on our last night and wished we had found it sooner. The other meals we had around Rome where good but I cant remember then to tell you. I drank house red with every meal - lovely! We spent one morning at a swimming pool - we had read we could use a near by hotel pool so aske dthe hotel reception to get the details for us - which they did but she also told us about a place at the end of the blue tube line EUR Palasport, where she herself goes, so we went there as it was cheaper. It took 20 mins on the tube and it was easy to find across the road on the left the enternace is on the road side - we walked thru the park and had to walk all the way around the outside to get to the enternace! It was good fun, you must wear a swimming hat as you do allover Italy. It was really funny watching the localls doing a water exercise class with the 'typical' instructor standing in the front! I am sure I cant write about it even tho it was so funny! One of those you would have to be ther things! It was a good move as we ahd all been on the go for 4 days and our son played in the water for 4 hours - we didnt see him - apart from checking on him! We left there and headed for Piazza Navona and sat for a while watching the world go by! Other than the usual places that are a must we also had a look in the Farari (sorry if i spelt it wrong - I am a girl) shop - not sure if that was a little extra for our son or my husband and as I messed up the coin throwing in the trevi andf had to go back to do it again ( I still dont know if I got it right as we went back after dinner and so after wine - at least we got to see the trevi at night) I didnt mind the detour to the car shop! All in all a fantastic trip and a gem of a hotel! If you had read allthis waffle then you deserve to know that as soon as we arrived we left our bags and headed of to the other sideo f the termini to get an open top tour bus - which was great for getting our bearings and was nice to sit on the top and get our fisrt look at Rome. We sat on it all the way round which took a couple of hours. It was well worth the money - was kind of like we saw it all then and there! Wont every forget our sons face as he had his first view of the colosseum! Turned a corner on the bus and there it was at the end of the road d d derrrrrrrrrr the Colosseum! Go a bit more look to the side and there it is Circo Massimo! St Peters and the Vatican, the river and the old old Castel Sant' Angelo....................................Go, have fun, enjoy! Best street may I found was the one in the AA spiral bound Rome guid £9.99.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal so far”
Reviews.Author: Familia_hos
Reviews.Content: When we planned a trip to Rome, a friend of mine suggested to stay close to termini station so it would be easy for us to go everywhere in the city. We went to Rome in the highest season, which is on August, so it was pretty hard to find hotel to stay. But we managed to find this hotel from google since 3 months earlier. Yes hotel is quiet new, so it was pretty hard to find the reviews from other travellers. When I openned tripadvisor website 3 months ago, I only found one review of the hotel and I am quiet surprised actually to see the increasing number of the reviews. That means good! So anyway, even so, finally we decided to book it cause I preferred to choose a new hotel than to gamble on hotels which post their back 15-20 years pictures on their websites. Plenty of old hotels in Rome, so I would prefer a new one than the old one. In the beginning we thought that the hotel is quiet far from Termini station, but actually it's very very close and not more than 5 minutes walking. If you get out from the east door of Termini Station (next to track no.1) you need to take left, and turn right on Via Vicenza, and on the first cross road of Via Vicenza take left and the first building on the left is the Hotel. But I must warn you that the name is pretty confusing. On the door it does say "Yes Hotel entrance" but on the board says "Hotel New York". ?? We stayed the three of us, so we booked a triple room, which has one large size bed and one single bed. The room is very clean, and rather small, maybe because they just add one single bed on the double room, but it still OK. Beside the beds, they have one flat LCD TV with some Italian channels, table with chair, small fridge and a wardrobe with locker. The Bathroom is clean and have everything that you need, towels, soap and shampoo gel, and it is not that small although they do not have bath tub. Everything on the room was computerized. For example if you open the window, automatically the Air Conditioner will be off. You also can set up the door message (don't disturb, please clean the room) electronically from inside the room. The window can be closed well, so although we were on the second floor, we did not hear anything from outside. You do not need to worry about the noise from outside the hotel. For breakfast, you have option to include it on the room or not. If you do not want hassle, i suggest to take the room including the breakfast. They have small dining room which can be fit for more or less 24 people, everything was new and nice. I heard from some friends who visited Rome, that the breakfast in most Rome hotels were a bit disappointing because consisted with croissants, toaster bread and coffee in small portions only. But fortunately in Yes Hotel, they serve continental breakfast including croissant, plain bread, various toaster bread (biscuito), good cheese and ham, 3 types of cereal, several types of jam. For drink, they have coffee, milk, water, tea, and not so fresh juice. They also serve the fruits salad. I think all the Hotel staffs can speak English well, and they were also very friendly and helpful since from the beginning when we booked. Overall I think Yes Hotel is really good deal. We paid 110 Euro for triple room including breakfast on the high season. If you pay with credit card I think the price is a bit higher around 124 Euros/night. I highly recommend this hotel for families or someone who travels to Rome. It's best deal that I got in Europe so far.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Choice that You’ll be Proud of”
Reviews.Author: Jsocan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a family reunion trip with 10 family members. We stayed one night at this hotel on Aug 12 after our Mediterranean cruise. We booked this hotel after reading through numerous Rome hotel reviews for the reasons of location, price and the fact that the hotel was brand new. We already had the expectation of a new 3-star hotel, but when we arrived, the impression we had was nothing short of a 'WOW'. The interior design is very modern, clean and fashionable (check out the bamboo-mat like designer floor tiles and the slick elevator in the lobby). The hotel also has quite a state-of-the-art energy saving control system that is a win-win for the environment and the hotel. For each room, there is a card sensor where you place a key card close to it to open the door. The card sensor also has a 'Do Not Disturb' indicator to replace the traditional door-knob hanger. Once you are in the room, there is a card slot with flashing blue light where you insert the key card to turn on the light and start the air conditioner. Next to the card slot is the temperature control for the air conditioner. It starts at 23 degree Celsius and you can adjust the temperature up and down. Setting it to 19 degree Celsius during the day and 24 degree Celsius at night worked well for us. Another power-smart feature is the air conditioner shuts off automatically if the window is open. The bathroom fan is also sensor controlled but you need to at least turn on the main bathroom light to activate the sensor. When you leave the room, taking out the key card from the card slot automatically turn off everything after a few minutes. The lights in the corridors are also motion-sensor controlled. They automatically turn on when someone approaches and turn off minutes later when there is nobody present. Another smart design feature is the use of floor tiles instead of carpet throughout the hotel. The floor tiles won't soil and trap allergens so they stay new and it is the best thing for allergy suffers like me. Our group stayed at a deluxe (quadruple) room and two superior (triple) rooms at €114 and €134 each respectively. The quadruple room (room 215) was very roomy and the triple rooms (rooms 216 and 202) were good sized as well. All our rooms have a large bathroom (by Rome standard) and a flat screen TV. My room (215) faced the front but either the street was very quiet or the window was very sound-proofed, I didn't hear any road noise at all. Other reviewers' comment about noise from the corridor and next rooms did not materialize for us. The fire exit route map is on the back of the door. The fire exit was just next to my room and the exit door has a big red cross-bar that you push to open. The hotel is located one block away from the main terminal station on a small street. We didn't need a map. We just followed the direction on the hotel confirmation email and it took us less than two minutes to walk from the station to the hotel. There was no hotel sign though. The hotel name is only on the entrance glass door but you can look for the big Hotel Milani sign as it is just opposite Yes Hotel across the street. The area is actually quite safe as it is packed with hotels and there are more tourists than locals on the streets. The staff at the front desk was very helpful with directions, bus/train information and restaurant suggestions. We also found out from the staff that there was a supermarket just down the street. The breakfast was basic (no real fruit juice) but adequate, and the staff did replenish the items when they ran out. I'm not a coffee drinker but my wife thought the coffee was okay. The only negative thing with the hotel is they don't accept single-night bookings for Saturdays. Otherwise, we would have stayed there also for the night prior to boarding our cruise. Instead, we had to stay one night at Hotel Columbia (our second choice) which had an excellent roof-top breakfast but at twice the room rate as Yes Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellant hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: jroyle
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 days in rome. Stayed at the Yes hotel. got the Terravision coach from airport to termini,(bought it at Liverpool Airport £10 for return ticket, saved mither when we got to Rome) and hotel literally one block round the corner away. Bit confusing as the sign on wall says Hotel New York, but name on the door says Yes. Obviously not got round to changing the sign yet. Brilliant location. we too stayed in a room lower down the street. but found it quiet, clean and for a room in central Rome quite spacious. there was a little noise from the next room but not enough to bother us. decor was lovely, flat screen tv with the usual news channels. the bathroom was twice as big a one we had at another hotel before and was spotlessly cleaned every day. more than adequate. The air con worked brilliantly in fact a bit too cold at times, and it did have a tendancy to still come on every morning at 7am even when I had turned it off earler. It was like an icy alarm clock , but at least it worked well. Cant fault the accomodation in any way. The breakfast was not the best continental breakfast I have ever had, but not the worst. always something to have. usual cereal, rolls cheese and ham etc. the coffee was pretty awful, would suggest taking a jar of alta rica with you and just use the hot water button. One morning went to the main street and had a lovely croissant, fresh orange and a coffee whilst watching Rome start the day. Lovely. I went with my daughter and didnt feel nervous walking in the area. although at night I did tend to go to the top of the street and get a taxi, not too dear and worth it after a day on foot. There is an area near the metro station where the homeless seem to spend the night but we just didnt go there at night and no problems during the day as far as we could see. Had a wonderful meal at piazza navona at the Tre Scalini Rest. wonderful, our local italian at home told us to pre book, and we would get a good table and service and we did. spent a lovely evening eating wonderful food drinking lovely wine and watching the world go by. A wonderful end to the day. Not the cheapest meal we had but worth every penny. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Rome, Great Hotel, Wonderful Food and Friendly people. Would definately go again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: DocAMH
Reviews.Content: My daughter and i stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and found it to be very comfy and clean. Maybe the rooms are a bit small but very modern and room cleaned every day. The location is good, near Termini station which is a pretty dodgy place to be (as we were told by hotel reception. Reception is very helpful, they gave us a great map and she told us how to get to places and the best times. The immediate area is very quiet really, the resturantes are pretty grim to be honest. There are two main metro lines in Rome and you can get around no problem to all of the sites. I would use this hotel again for location. Like in any city, be vigilant, hold on to your bags and have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Lof
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Yes hotel from 30 June for four nights, then after interrailing around Italy, came back to the same place for our final night before flying home. The hotel was much better than expected. All newly refurbished, the room and bathroom were spacious and clean (we stayed in a classic room after booking through Expedia). Location-wise, it was only 5 mins (if that) from the railway and bus station (perfect for us), and not particularly far from anything. The area is fine - a couple of homeless people on the street of the hotel, and more around the train/bus station, but never felt unsafe. The air con in the room wasn't too much of an issue - we simply asked Reception to turn it on in our room, then controlled it in the room by opening the windows (which shuts the a/c off). Not ideal but didn't cause any problems. Only slight issue we had was the noise in the corridors - our room was on the second floor right by the lifts. As there is no carpet in the hotels, we could hear people constantly running up and down the corridors, and the walls were quite thin. Breakfast was ok - nothing spectacular but it was enough. We found the reception staff friendly and helpful - for example, they helped us find better restaurants/bars (which are generally located in Campo del Fiore). Worth mentioning that when we stayed at the hotel again before returning home, we stayed in a smaller double room. It was in a separate building further down from the hotel. Size was fine. Cleanliness was ok, but found a few bugs around the room. It did feel strange staying in a separate building, but all in all it was fine. We would definitely return to this hotel - preferably for a classic room, rather than the standard double.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great Location! Great For Ur Budget!!!”
Reviews.Author: Travel039
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and had a wonderful stay. I work in the hospitality industry so I'm always a little extra picky about hotels. People should be able to pay a reasonable rate for a nice clean hotel in a good location. The Yes Hotel meets completely meets that criteria. The rooms are spacious, very clean, modern and simple. I can't think of a single complaint, from the front desk staff to the showers. Rome is very hot in June and the Yes Hotel was always refreshing and relaxing to come back to after a long day of sight seeing. Rooms - The rooms look exactly like the pictures on their official website. We had a superior room with three beds. Our room had plenty of space for and more than enough room for our luggage. Loved it!!! Nice flat screen TV with 2 or 3 English channels, which is hard to find any where in Rome. Make sure to keep your windows closed when the air conditioning is on. For those Americans who might think this is silly it's actually very smart because it conserves energy which is good for the environment. I only wish more American hotel chains would have the same technology. Cleanliness - Impeccably clean and sanitary. The bath rooms are nice and they come with large towels. The shower is great and good water pressure. I would agree with other readers about the bathroom fan. It's a little annoying but definitely not enough to bypass staying at this hotel. Location - The hotel is 2 minutes walking distance from Termini Station which is perfect for taking the train to all the tourist spots. Navigating the city wasn't hard because your getting on at Termini station which gives you access to the A and B line. Instead of having to backtrack to Termini to switch train lines. Perfect location if your navigating the city on your own. Don't waste your money taking a taxi from the airport, instead take the direct Leonardo Express Train which drops you off at Termini station and there are no stops. Very Very convenient and only 11 Euro!!!! The streets are fine during the day and just use caution when walking around at night. It's not a reflection of the hotel but Rome in general which is a urban city. If your expecting quite Italian streets, grow up and realize the world is not designed to suit delicate sensibilities. It's also nice being close to Termini because there are lots of stores at Termini. Perfect for picking up a quick sandwich or things you forgot at home like toothpaste or an extra pair of pajamas. Over all I would high recommend this hotel to anyone and their families. I hope you enjoy

HotelInfo.Name: Yes Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Magenta 15, 00185 Rome, Italy
